Marina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 26 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Ejmiatsin town. Nelly keeps a greenhouse, where she cultivates vegetables and roses. Nelly's husband and his parents are also involved in farming. 

Nelly is requesting a loan to purchase potato seeds. She hopes to gather a rich potato harvest and generate more income from its sales. In the future, Nelly has plans to construct a new greenhouse and grow more roses.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana de 42 años. Hace 20 años unió su vida a Félix, el padre de sus 2 hijos: Miguel de 19 y Doris de 17 años. Ella vida contenta rodeada de su familia en una casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Yanama Alto, distrito de Palca – Tarma. Sebastiana se dedica a la agricultura, que es la principal actividad económica del lugar. Desde que empezó a convivir con Félix empezó a sembrar arvejas y papas en todas sus variedades. “Para que haya buena producción se tiene que estar constante en la chacra (terreno de cultivo)”, dice. También cría animales, como ovejas y 4 vacas a las que cuida mucho, ya que le brindan leche. Con la adquisición de sus ovejas y la leche de sus vacas, puede tener un ingreso extra al hogar. 
Félix trabaja junto con ella en estas arduas tareas, por eso sus resultados son mayores y sus ventas mejor canalizadas. De esa manera llegó hasta la ciudad de Lima para comercializar sus productos al por mayor.
Con la fuerza y firmeza que la caracteriza seguirá trabajando en lo que el gusta: la agricultura, para aumentar sus ventas y generar más ahorros. Éste sería su crédito número 2 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. “Los Manantiales de Yanama”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, se siente contenta de formar parte de un grupo de personas cuyos objetivos son similares.
Sebastiana invertirá el dinero en la compra de 2 bolsas de semillas con 1200 soles; lo restante será destinado a la compra de bolsas de guano de corral y granja.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 42 years old.  For the last 20 years, she has been united in life with Félix, the father of her two children:  Miguel, aged 19 and Doris, aged 17.  She lives contentedly, surrounded by her family in their own house, which is located in the village of Yanama Alto, in the district of Palca-Tarma.

Sebastiana works in agriculture, which is the principal economic activity of the region.  When she began living with Félix, she began growing peas and potatoes in all their varieties.  “As there's been good production, I've need to be constantly on the farmland", she says.  She also raises animals, such as sheep and four cows who she looks after carefully as they provide milk.  With the acquisition of her sheep and her cows' milk, she can earn a little extra income for her household.
 
Félix works with her on these arduous tasks, which is why their results are stronger and their sales are better channeled.  He goes to the city of Lima to sell their products at wholesale.

With the strength and firmness which characterizes her, Sebastiana continues working doing what she enjoys, agriculture, to increase her sales, and earn more savings. 

This will be her second loan with MFP, so she agrees to make her monthly repayments punctually.  “Los Manantiales de Yanama” ["The Springs of Yanama"] is the name of her communal bank.  She is happy to be part of a group of people whose objectives are similar.

Sebastiana will invest the money in purchasing two bags of seeds for 1,200 soles.  The remainder will be used to purchase bags of farmyard manure.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of pea seeds, and sacks of farmyard manure.

loans.name: Fredis Argentina

texts.es:
Doña Fredis es una  persona  muy trabajadora, actualmente  vive  con  su  esposo  y  sus  3 hijos  con quines vive departamento de  Choluteca. Y   Se  dedica  a su negocio  propio que es una pulpería.
Doña Fredis el  préstamo  lo necesita  para  la  compra  de refrescos, maíz, leche, frijoles, pan, lácteos, embutidos, pastas, harina, etc.
Doña Fredis espera que al finalizar el  verano tener  bien  surtido  el  negocio  ya  que en el invierno es una  zona  muy  productiva  de   mariscos  y  otro tipo  de  actividades.
Doña Fredis desea tener  más mercadería  y  poder  crecer   en este  tipo  de negocio y Seguir  trabajando  duro  para  a si   terminar  de  darles  a  sus  hijos  lo  mejor  que  es  la  educación y a sí  que  sean  personas  de  bien  para  poder  ayudar  a su familia   ya  que  son personas humildes y de escasos recursos económicos.


Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo  del 2012
texts.en:
Fredis is a very hardworking person who is living with her husband and three children in Coluteca Department.  She has a business of her own: a grocery store.

Fredis needs the loan to buy soft-drinks, corn, milk, beans, dairy products, cured meats, noodles, flour, etc.

Fredis hopes that at summer’s end she’ll have the store well-stocked because in winter the zone is very productive of seafood and other activities.

Fredis wants to have more merchandise to grow in her business and continue to work hard in order to finish providing her children with the best education so that they will grow into upstanding citizens and to be able to help her family because they are humble people of scarce economic resources.

Choluteca, Honduras – March, 2012

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is a 53-year-old mother who loves to sell pork, egg, and chicken barbecue in the market. This is her way of gaining income for their daily living while her husband cultivates their farmland. They live in a village with their five children. Through their patience and sacrifices, they survived poverty. At this time, some of their children are already married and have their own families.

Isabelita aims to continue and improve her business to earn and save more income for their future. She is asking for additional capital of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy pork, eggs, chicken heads and intestines, liver, and seasonings needed for making barbecue. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business and is hoping that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: To buy pork, eggs, chicken heads and intestines, liver, and seasonings needed for making barbecue.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
Nicanor tiene 57 años; está casado con Natividad, la madre de sus 9 hijos, pero solo vive con 4 de ellos, ya que los demás son independientes y ya tienen familia propia. Esta familia vive unida en una casa propia ubicada en el anexo de Yanama, distrito de Palca – Tarma. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a la agricultura. Esta actividad se la inculcaron sus padres. Gracias su destreza en el trabajo en el campo consiguió adquirir terrenos propios. “Siembro papa, arveja, olluco, lechugas, zanahoria, gladiolo, de todo, porque así ya tengo para los gastos de todo el año”, comenta confiado.
Comercializa sus productos casi todo el año, esa es la ventaja de sembrar constantemente. Traslada sus cosechas hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Pero en los meses de enero, febrero y marzo, la papa tiene gran demanda en la ciudad de Lima, por eso viaja frecuentemente. Lo mismo sucede en mayo y noviembre con la venta de flores de gladiolos. Nicanor también se dedica a la ganadería. Gracias a sus vacas lecheras prepara quesos y vende leche. Está contento de vivir en el campo, a pesar del frío y las intensas lluvias que dificultan su trabajo. Éste su crédito número 8 con MFP, asegura que será puntual el pago de las cuotas mensuales.  Espera de su apoyo para lograr sus objetivos. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Manantiales de Yanama”. Se siente bien trabajando con personas responsables y solidarias.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de 3 bolsas de semillas de arvejas, lo restante será para adquirir abonos.
texts.en:
Nicanor is 57 years old and married with Natividad, the mother of their 9 children. Only 4 still live with them; the remainder are independent and now have families of their own. His family lives together in their own house, located in the annex of Yanama in the Palca district of Tarma. For more than 30 years, Nicanor has been farming. He learned the trade from his parents. Thanks to his skill in agricultural work, he managed to acquire his own fields. “I sow potatoes, green peas, 'olluco' [an Incan tuber, like potatoes], lettuce, carrots, and gladiolas, everything, because in this manner, I have income to cover expenses all year,” he commented confidently.

Nicanor sells his harvests almost all year round -- this is the advantage of planting constantly. He transports his harvests to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. During the months of January, February, and March, potatoes are in great demand in the city of Lima and Nicanor travels there frequently. The same occurs in May and November, when he sells gladiolas.

Nicanor raises cattle as well. Thanks to his milk cows, he also makes cheeses and sells milk. He is content to live in the countryside, despite the cold and the intense rains that make his work difficult. 

This is his 8th loan through MFP, and Nicanor assures us that the monthly payments will be made punctually. He awaits this help in order to achieve his objectives. Nicanor belongs to “Los Manantiales de [The Fountains of] Yanama” communal bank. He is very satisfied to work with such responsible and supportive people. He will invest the money in purchasing 3 bags of green pea seeds; the remainder will be used to acquire fertilizers.

loans.use: purchase 3 bags of green pea seeds plus sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Tacajalve Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos Maria es casada, tiene 39 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de alimento concentrado para animales, inició este negocio con una tienda y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia en este negocio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de concentrado para alimento de aves y purina alimento de gatos y perros, ya que en el futuro quiere ver un negocio grande. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la venta de ropa y a la atención a tienda en general.
texts.en:
Santos María, 39, is married.  She never went to school.  She has five children two of which attend school.  She is a merchant.  She sells animal feed concentrate.  She started the business with a store and to date has six years’ experience in this business.  Her husband sells clothes and helps with support.

She organized a group in order to request a loan that she’ll use to buy fowl feed concentrate and Purina cat and dog food because in future she wants her business to be larger.  

The other group members sell clothes and run a general store.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate to sell.

loans.name: Ever Orlando

texts.es:
El Joven Ever, tiene 27 años de edad, soltero y reside desde hace más de 4 años en la ciudad de Danlí, él se dedica a la venta y reparación de relojes de diferentes marcas, estilos y colores, su negocio lo ha nombrado como relojería Cristal. 
Ever el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de 75 relojes para dama, 70 relojes de varón de diferentes marcas, colores y estilos y 100 relojes de moda actuales, Con el préstamo de PRISMA podrá abastecer más su negocio lo que incrementara más sus ventas y atraerá mas clientela por el surtido que tendrá mejorando así sus utilidades.
Ever tiene planes a futuro de casarse y formar su familia, pero su sueño inmediato es comprarse un vehiculo para comercializar su mercadería. 


Danlí, el paraíso, Honduras - Marzo de 2012
texts.en:
Ever is 27 years old, single, and has lived in the city of Danlí for the past 4 years. He sells and repairs different brands, styles, and colors of watches and has named his business Cristal Watches. Ever will use this loan to purchase 75 women's watches and 70 men's watches of various brands, colors, and styles, and 100 fashion watches. 

With the loan from PRISMA, he will be able to stock more merchandise, which will increase his sales and attract more customers. The selection will allow him to improve his profits. In the future, Ever plans to marry and start a family, but his immediate dream is to buy a vehicle to market his merchandise.

Danlí, paradise, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy women's and men's watches for his business.

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La  Señora Cristina   es una  persona  muy  emprendedora  dedicada   a su  negocio,  es madre  de  3 hijos  los  cuales  son  del  sexo  femenino, sus hijas le  ayudan   con  su negocio,  ella vive en  el  departamento   de  Choluteca  en  el  sur  del   honduras.
Doña Cristina la ejerce  desde ya  hace  mas de  15  años la actividad de Venta  de  refrescos, churros, sandalias y otros productos,  El  préstamo  lo  necesita  para  la  compra  de    refrescos, churros, recargas, sandalias y otros productos para la venta.
Doña Cristina con el  préstamo   espera  vender  mas   ya  que  tiene  poco  capital  para este  tipo de  negocio. En  poco  tiempo espera  poner  su  pulpería  en  su  casa  ya  que  el  negocio  que  tiene  ahora  lo hace  a  domicilio. 



Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo  del 2012
texts.en:
Cristina is a very enterprising person who is dedicated to her business.  She’s the mother of three children who are girls.  Her daughters help her with the business.  She lives in Choluteca Department in the south of Honduras.

Cristina has been selling soft-drinks, snacks, sandals and other products for more than 15 years.  She needs the loan to buy soft-drinks, snacks, recharges, sandals and other products to sell.

Cristina hopes with the loan to sell more since she has little capital for this type of business.  In a short time she hopes to open a grocery store at home because the business she has now is home delivery.

Choluteca, Honduras – March, 2012

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Book Khoole 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "BOOK KHOOLE 1" qui signifie "coeurs unis" est constituée de cinq femmes toutes mariées.Depuis trois ans, elles exercent dans le commerce de vêtements pour femmes et enfants, de chaussures et de produits cosmétiques.Avec les revenus tirés de ce commerce, elles prennnent en charge leurs propres besoins et parviennent aussi à soutenir leurs maris dans les dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles respectives.Afin de renforcer leurs fonds de commerce, les femmes sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter des vêtements, des chaussures et des produits cosmétiques.Le groupe ambitionne d'élargir ses activités.
texts.en: The Book Khoole 1 group (the name of the group means « United Hearts ») is composed of five married women. For three years, they have been selling women’s and children’s clothing, shoes, and cosmetic products. With the revenues derived from their business, they provide for their personal needs and also manage to help their respective husbands with household expenses. In order to bolster their work capital, the group members are seeking a loan of 500,000 West African francs to buy women’s and children’s clothing, shoes, and cosmetic products. The group’s goal is to expand  its business activities.

loans.use: to buy women’s and children’s clothing, shoes, and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice lives in Yambio, South Sudan. She sells food in a food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 20 years old and married with no children.

Loice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds (SDG) to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for resale.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
Feliciano, de 50 años de edad; es un hombre soltero; vive en su propia casa donde habita solo junto a su negocio.  Feliciano, es un hombre de provecho; su labor principal es la venta de diferentes mercaderías como: ferretería, agroquímicos, venta de materiales de escritorio, productos de abarrotes, etc.  Esta labor lleva realizando hace 19 años y comenta que le ha ido muy bien ya que en su localidad es el único con este negocio. Por el momento, cuenta con un ayudante que le apoya, mientras Feliciano,  sale de viaje para realizar sus compras que ofrece a sus clientes. Lo que mas le gusta de este trabajo es que gracias a ello puede tener un solvento económico para sí mismo.
Con el préstamo solicitado de MFP, viajará a la ciudad de Lima para poder comprar útiles escolares de diversas variedades para esta campaña escolar; ya que sus clientes necesitan para sus hijos. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, se siente contento por recibir este apoyo económico ya que de esa forma continuará con sus planes de trabajo; asimismo, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago ya que desea acceder a otro. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles mas el capital de sus ganancias, se abastecerá de materiales de educación como: cuadernos, lapiceros, entre  otros.
texts.en:
Feliciano, 50, is single.  He lives in his own house by himself alongside his business.  Feliciano is a go-getter; his main occupation is selling various merchandise like hardware, agrochemicals, office supplies, groceries, etc.   

He’s been in this line of work for 19 years and comments that he’s done very well because he’s the only one in this business in his location.  For the moment, he has an assistant that helps him while Feliciano goes on buying trips to buy what he needs to offer his customers.  What he likes best about his work is being able to have economic solvency for himself.

With the loan requested from MFP he will travel to the city of Lima to buy assorted school supplies for the next school term because his customers need them for their children.  

This will be loan #1 with MFP.  He feels happy to receive this economic support because he will be able to continue with his work plans this way.  Also, he commits to be punctual with his payments because he’d like to access another loan.

He will use the 3000 new soles plus capital from profits to stock up on school supplies like notebooks and pencils, among others.

loans.use: to buy school supplies like notebooks and pencils.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es: Alberta, es una mujer muy activa y empeñosa; tiene 35 años de edad; vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Juan de 36 años y sus 03 hijos a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Alberta se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como: arroz, conservas, bebidas, golosinas, verdura, etc. Su tienda esta ubicada en su propia casa; esta actividad viene realizando hace 11 años; a veces lo hace con la ayuda de su esposo y a veces recibe el apoyo de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de trabajo es poder estar tranquila al pendiente de su familia  y lo más difícil es cuando sube los precios de los productos. Pero aun así para ella este trabajo le es muy fácil de realizar  porque es lo que mas sabe hacer. Ahora después de meses  que llego a vender casi toda la mercadería pues se preocupa por aumentar más víveres; es por ello que acude a las oficinas de MFP para que le apoyen con préstamo y de esa manera logre cumplir con sus objetivos. Sus planes a futuro es que sus hijos sean profesionales y tengan un buen futuro. Este será su crédito número 03 con MFP; y agradece el apoyo porque gracias a ello puede cumplir con sus planes de trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participe y sobre todo responsable. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles podrá abastecerse de mercadería para su negocio y de esa forma no poder faltarle nada en las compras de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alberta, 35, is an active, enterprising woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Juan, 36, and their three children who she wants to provide a better quality of life for.  

Alberta sells groceries like rice, canned goods, soft-drinks, snacks, vegetables, etc.  Her store is located in her house.  She’s been in this line of work for 11 years.  Sometimes her husband helps her and sometimes her children do.  What she most likes about the work is being able to be at peace watching over her family.  What’s most difficult is when the price of her products rises.  Even so, this work is easy for her to do because it’s what she knows how to do best.  

Now, after having sold out most of her merchandise these months she’s concerned about increasing her stock again and this is why she comes by MFP’s offices to seek support from a loan in order to reach her objectives.  Her plans for the future are that her children become professionals and that they have good futures.

This will be loan #3 with MFP and she gives thanks for the support because thanks to it she’s able to reach her work plans.  She is a very participative and above all responsible member of her communal bank.

She will use the 2000 new soles to stock up on merchandise for her business so that she won’t lack anything for her customers’ purchases.

loans.use: to buy varied merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 38 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  She lives in Yambio. She runs a food stall, which she has been doing for five years.  

Alice is requesting her first loan from BRAC for 1,000 Sudanese pounds, which she will use to purchase beans and rice.  Alice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 32 years old. He and his wife Ephalina are blessed with four children. He repairs shoes, a business he has been doing for the past four years, and earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES). He is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase materials like threads and polish for shining shoes, which he requires for his work. 

The profit he earns from his business will be invested back into his business. His dream is to become a successful businessman. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase materials like threads and polish for shining shoes.

loans.name: David Orlando

texts.es:
El joven David de 21 años de edad,  es soltero no tiene hijos que dependen den el, vive en casa de sus padres y vive en San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras.
David tiene un negocio de pulpería en donde vende arroz, frijoles, manteca, maíz, maicillo, refrescos y esta solicitando 15,000.00 lempiras, para la compra de manteca, maíz, maicillo, frijoles, frescos, con la compra de estos producto David pretende tener mas ganancias con esto mejorara las condiciones de vida  tanto de el como la de su mama quien es la persona que siempre lo ha apoyado tanto en sus estudios como en sus decisiones.
Los planes de David es invertir el préstamo en su negocio y hacerlo crecer al igual tiene un sueño que es el de construir su casa para cuando se case no tenga que rentar una casa para su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Young David is 21.  He’s single and has no dependent children.  He lives in his parents’ house in San Lorenzo in the southern part of Honduras.

David has a grocery store where he sells rice, beans, lard, corn, cornmeal and soft-drinks.  He’s asking for 15000 lempiras to buy lard, corn, cornmeal, beans, and soft-drinks. With this purchase, David will be able to have more profits thus improving both his and his mother’s quality of life that has always supported him in his schooling and with his decisions.

David’s plans are to invest the loan in his business and make it grow.  He also dreams with building a house so that when he gets married he won’t have to rent a house for his family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March, 2012

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Adia

texts.en:
Adia lives in Yambio, South Sudan. She sells food in a food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 32 years old and married, with four children who are all in school.

Adia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds (SDG) to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
El señor Juan de 31 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos que dependen de el, su esposa se dedica a las labores domesticas y sus dos hijos están pequeños uno de ellos va a la escuela. el vive en el barrio en San Lorenzo.
Juan tiene un taller de reparación de vehículos en su casa, ahí en su taller repara todo tipo de vehículos, con la ayuda de un empleado a quien le paga semanal por su trabajo.
Juan desea comprar más herramientas como Torque, Llaves de Carraca, Llaves para filtros, Embocinador entre otros  para su taller ya que las herramientas que tiene ya casi no le funcionan por la antigüedad que tienen.
Con mejores herramientas se trabajara mejor y su taller atraerá mas clientes que le dejaran mas ingresos para sostener a su familia.
El sueño de Juan  es construir una galera para trabajar bien y protegerse del sol y la lluvia y que sus hijos crezcan sanos, también desea hacer su propia casa.



San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Juan, 31, is married and has two dependent children; his wife does domestic chores and his two children are little, one of them attends school.  He lives in the San Lorenzo neighborhood.

Juan has a car repair shop at home.  He repairs all types of vehicles there with help from an employee he pays a weekly wage for his labor.

Juan wants to buy more work tools like wrenches, ratchet wrenches, oil filter wrench, flaring tool, among others for his shop because the tools he has are almost inoperative because they are so old.   With better tools he will work better and his shop will attract more customers leading to more income earned to support his family.

Juan’s dream is to build a large shed to work well in and protect himself from the sun and the rain and that his children grow up healthy; he also wants to build a house of his own.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March, 2012

loans.use: to buy tools for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en:
Knarik is 43 years old. She lives in Azatek village and is married with three children. Knarik is a teacher at the local school. She is also involved in agriculture with her husband. They run a farm where they breed cows. 

The family's current income is barely enough to cover daily costs, so Knarik would like to make the farm more profitable. Thus, she plans to purchase two cows and five pigs. This will allow Knarik to get more income and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for cows and pigs.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Yambio. She has a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 28 years old, single, and has two children, both of whom are still in school. 

Anna heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bean and rice for sale.

loans.name: Amer

texts.es: Amer, de 31 años es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador; vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Haydee de 30 años y sus dos queridos hijos Aldair de 11 y Mayely de 07 años. El trabajo de Amer, es de mucho empeño y esfuerzo; su mayor tiempo pasa en su campo de cultivo viendo la producción de su siembra; esta labor lleva realizando hace 08 años. En los tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de peones porque de esa manera puede extraer rápido los frutos; después de lo cosecha él lo lleva a vender a las sociedades acopiadoras quienes le gratifican a muy buenos precios por cada kilogramo. Con el tiempo desea comprar más tierras para que en ellas llegue a cultivar más plantas de coca y raíces de barbasco, de las que ya tiene. Ahora lo que prioriza es poder fumigar sus cultivos; porque gracias a la buena cosecha podrá tener buen sustento económico. Este es su crédito número 05 con MFP y se siente muy contento por contar con el apoyo financiero; además se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos. En su banco comunal se lleva bien con todos y agradece que sus compañeros sean responsables. Con el préstamo solicitado podrá comprar agroquímicos para mantener fértiles su producción.
texts.en:
Amer is a 31-year-old rsponsible, hardworking man. He lives in his own home with Haydee, his wife of 30 years, and their two beloved children, 11-year-old Aldair and 7-year-old Mayely. Amer's work requires a lot of determination and effort. For the past 8 years, most of his time has been spent in the fields overseeing his plantings. At harvest time, he has help from other laborers so that he can complete it quickly. After harvesting, he takes his products to sell to the warehouses where he receives very good prices per kilogram. 

Over time he wants to purchase more land so that he can raise more cacao and barbasco plants. Now his priority is to fumigate the crops. A better harvest will provide more income. This will be his 5th loan cycle with MFP, and he is happy to have the financial support. He also promises to make his payments on time. He gets along with all the members of his communal bank and is grateful that his companions are responsible.  With the loan he is requesting, he will be able to purchase pesticides to keep his fields fertile.

loans.use: to buy pesticides.

loans.name: Eternel Plus Group

texts.en:
Mudilawe joined one of Hope’s groups (a DRCongo Microfinance program) named “Eternel Plus” in 2009. He is the chairman of that group, which consists of nine members. Thanks to Hope’s loans, the group members’ businesses have prospered. 

Mudilawe is 42 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of 1 and 15. He has been active in his business since 1990. He sells foam mattresses to the east of Kinshasa. Mudilawe is dedicated to his business, which generates a profit of US $180 per week. His business is the only source of income he has to support his family. 

Mudilawe has already received and successfully repaid nine loans. He is planning to use the coming loan to purchase some foam mattresses of good quality that are needed by his clients in order to generate more profit. His dream is to open a foam mattress shop in his environment.

loans.use: to increase the stock of his business by purchasing some foam mattresses to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Kolletha

texts.en:
Kolletha lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 28 years old, married, and has no children.

Kolletha heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Yambio, South Sudan. She sells clothes, and has been in business for four years. She is 42 years old and married with six children, three of whom are still in school. 

Christine heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds (SDG) to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 35 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 15 years. He sells sorghum, beans, and maize. This is his second year in this business and he currently employs two people to help him. 

Richard has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more sorghum, beans, and maize to sell. With the profits from the loan, he will be able to save for his future, pay medical insurance, and build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase more sorghum, beans, and maize to sell.

loans.name: Donath

texts.en:
Donath is 30 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 9 years. His business is well-organized and he sells coffee. He currently employs two people to help him and he has three years of experience. 

Donath has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his agriculture business by cultivating more coffee to sell. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs, to pay his children's school fees, and to be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to expand his agriculture business by cultivating more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Jocelinda

texts.es: Jocelinda de 26 años, vive con sus padres y su hermana Lisbet de 23 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo – Tarma. Con dulzura y carisma, Jocelinda cuenta que, desde los 15 años Jocelinda aprendió a ser una mujer responsable. Empezó trabajando en una panadería haciendo y vendiendo panes; con el tiempo abrió su propia panadería, ahí trabaja con su madre. “El trabajo en las panaderías es de noches, por eso dormimos pocas horas. Vale la pena”. Y como si fuera poco, está abnegada mujer también se dedica a la agricultura, ayudando a sus padres en las siembras de espinacas, zanahorias, lechugas, y otras hortalizas. Lo que más le gusta es ayudar a su familia, pues su mayor deseo es ver a su hermana realizada y a sus padres tranquilos. Ahora quiere comprar mayor mercadería para su panadería y adquirir su propio terreno y de esa manera poder cultivar mayor cantidad de hortalizas. Para ello contratará personal para optimizar estas labores. Éste sería su crédito número 3 que recibiría de MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal”, cuyos socios son solidarios y apuntan a un mismo fin: la superación. De recibir el dinero, Jocelinda podrá comprar sacos de harinas y otros insumos para preparar panes. Así también destinará una parte del dinero en la compra de abonos orgánicos para sus cultivos de zanahorias.
texts.en:
Jocelinda, 26, lives with her parents and her sister Lisbet, 23, in their own house located in the town of Palcamayo, Tarma.  With sweetness and charisma, Jocelinda says that at the age of 15 she learned to be a responsible woman.  She began working in a bakery making and selling bread.  In time she opened her own bakery and works there with her mother.

"Bakery work is at night, so we sleep very little.  It's worth it."  And if that were not enough, this selfless woman also works in agriculture, helping her parents growing spinach, carrots, lettuce, and other vegetables.  What she likes most is helping her family, because her greatest desire is to see her sister fulfilled and her parents calm.

Now she wants to buy more merchandise for her bakery and acquire her own plot of land to be able to grow a larger quantity of vegetables.  For this she will hire personnel to optimize these jobs.

This will be her third loan from MFP, so she gives her word that she will be punctual in making her monthly payments.  She is happy about belonging to her communal bank, Patrón San Cristóbal, whose members are supportive and indicate the same goal: self-improvement.

When she receives the money, Jocelinda will be able to buy sacks of flour and other ingredients to make bread.  She also will dedicate part of the money to buying organic fertilizer for her carrot crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer as well as sacks of flour to make bread.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, de 41 años de edad; vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Julio de de 51 años y sus 04 queridos hijos. Catalina, es una mujer muy laboriosa, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su propia casa; esta actividad lleva realizando hace 10 años. Durante las mañanas recibe el apoyo de sus hijos y esposo; ella se siente contenta ya que esta labor es lo que mejor sabe hacer, ofreciendo buena atención a sus clientes para que se sientan muy bien. Gracias a esta actividad, mas el ahorro e su esposo que va a laborar en su campo de cultivo, lograron comprar su casa en la que ahora reside con su familia.
Por otra parte hay inconvenientes para su negocio, como por ejemplo cuando llega a terminar su mercadería; por tal motivo acude a los financieros de MFP para solicitar un préstamo y de esa manera logre continuar con su plan de trabajo. 
Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos sean hombres de de bien y obtengan una mejor calidad de vida. Este es su crédito número 06 con MFP, se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus cuotas de pago como en anteriores créditos.  Asimismo en su banco comunal agradece por trabajar con socios responsables y solidarios.  
Con los 2.000 nuevos soles podrá abastecerse de mercadería para incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Catalina, 41, lives in her own house with her husband Julio, 51, and her four beloved children.  Catalina is a very industrious woman.  She works selling groceries in her own house.  She has been doing this work for ten years.  In the morning she gets help from her children and husband.  She is happy because this job is the best that she knows how to do, offering good service to her customers so they feel very good.  Thanks to this work, plus the savings of her husband, who goes to work on his plot of land, they managed to buy their house, in which she now lives with her family.

On the other hand, there are problems for her business, such as when her merchandise runs out.  For this reason she is turning to the MFP lenders to request a loan so she manages to continue with her work plan.

Her greatest desire is that her children will be good people and have a better quality of life.  This is her sixth loan with MFP.  She promises to be very punctual in making her payments, as with previous loans.  In addition, she is grateful to work with responsible and supportive members in her communal bank.

With the 2,000 nuevos soles (PEN) she will be able to stock up on merchandise to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities to supply her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, membre du groupe de crédit, elle est aussi enseignante dans une école conventionnée catholique, femme  dynamique, ambitieuse, entrepreneur autodidacte, âgée de 34 ans. Elle est  vendeuse des unités cellulaires. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans cette affaire, ce dernier ayant perdu dernièrement son emploi. Elle a commencé son business par son maigre salaire d’enseignant. Plus tard elle  fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l'IMF Hekima, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour renforcer  ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  11eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  250 cartes d’unités cellulaires (Vodacom,MTN,Air tel,CCT).  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une parcelle.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent doucement leurs bébés.
texts.en:
The client is a member of this group of borrowers, and a teacher in a catholic school. At 34 years old, she is a dynamic, ambitious, self-taught entrepreneur who sells cell phone units. She and her husband, who was recently let go from his position, support each other in conducting this business. 

She started this activity using her meager teacher’s salary. She later learned about microfinancing through the Hekima MFI, and obtained a first loan of $50 to strengthen her business. Profits from her activity are added to her savings and used to buy food and to provide for her children’s tuition. 

This is her 11th loan cycle. Having witnessed the positive growth of her activity over time, she decided to apply for a larger amount. This new loan will allow her to buy 250 cell phone unit cards (Vodacom, MTN, Air Tel, CCT). 

She hopes to see her children grow up, and she would like to purchase some land. 

She wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping poor women who don’t have access to traditional banks to become self-sufficient. It should be mentioned that some of the borrowers are gently carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy 250 cell phone unit cards (Vodacom, MTN, Air Tel, CCT) for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles, 45 years old and married to Lucy, has been a farmer in Njabini for the last 12 years. This father of four children is requesting a loan to buy cattle feed, fertilizer and seedlings and to pay for labour. In the future, Charles hopes to grow his business and improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed, fertilizer, and seedlings.

loans.name: C 10001 Kundumurimo Group

texts.en:
Celestin is 33 years old and is married with four children aged between 3 months and 7 years old and he takes care of six relatives. He sells potatoes. He is a leader of this group which is called "C10001 KUNDUMURIMO " in the local language and he's the one raising his hand. This is his 3rd year in this business and he currently employs five people to help him. 

Celestin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his agriculture business by cultivating more potatoes to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, to pay school fees for his children, and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To expand his agriculture business by  cultivating more potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 44 years old and married to Agnes who contributes to the family income. He has been operating his bookshop business for a period of about two years with an income of approximately 15,000 Kenya shillings a month.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD, and he hopes that it will enable him to boost and grow his business. He wants to use the loan to buy more Christian books and CDs  for sale. 

He hopes to be able to influence the community through his books and other Christian materials.

loans.use: to purchase Christian books and CDs for resale.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Claude is 30 years old and is married with two children aged 3 and 6 years old. He sells various goods such as lotions, soap, toothpaste, biscuits, sugar, rice, etc. This is his 10th year in this business and he currently employs one person to help him. 

Claude has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as lotions, soap, toothpaste, biscuits, sugar, rice, etc. to sell. With the profits from the loan, he will be able to save for his future, to pay school fees for his children, and he will be able to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as lotions, soap, toothpaste, biscuits, sugar, rice, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ebtesam

texts.en:
Ebtesam is a 53-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Ebtesam has a home-based project, selling clothes and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more clothes for business purposes. She is looking to open a shop for her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Went Plus Group

texts.en:
Mfutila, aged 50 and married, is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Went Plus”, which consists of 10 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Mfutila started his business in 1990. He has been operating a car wash service to the east of the city of Kinshasa. He is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC and has already received three different loans and has repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to increase the stock of his business by buying some car wash products and other goods with the aim of increasing the profits. Each week, his business brings in a profit of US$180. 
His ambition is to expand his business in Kinshasa. 

Mfutila has nine children whose ages are between 8 and 23 years old. Seven of them go to school.

loans.use: to increase the stock of his business by buying some car wash products and other goods.

loans.name: Dot

texts.en:
Dot, 33, a good mother of three single children, resides in Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. Most of her income is generated from agricultural businesses including rice farming, poultry-raising and pig husbandry. Dot built a wooden pigpen in her back yard in order to raise piglets. For additional income, she devotes her spare time to distilling Khmer traditional white wine made of rice, selling it to local people in her commune.

With the loan she is requesting, Dot will buy 15 piglets to further improve her business. With the rest of the money, she will buy sacks of fertilizers to enhance crop productivity. One day, Dot hopes to lift her family out of poverty and achieve a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy 15 piglets to further improve her business.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, 56, is a farmer who prefers rice husbandry for her livelihood. She resides in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She has been in this type of business since she was a teenager under the same roof with her parents. Her spouse also is in the same field. Together, they have been blessed with six children: three are married and three are single. 

Now, Lim needs sufficient capital to invest in her rice farming business. She will buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to protect her crops against the challenges of climate and insects. This loan will help in developing her current business as well as improving her living conditions. She hopes that she will be able to have a good harvest this year.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Hòa's Group

texts.en:
Hòa is applying for a loan to purchase machines to do tailor-made and clothing repair services. She has a business sewing clothes.

Hòa is 36 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 08.09.07- Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of five members. Hòa lives with her two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hòa first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hòa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hòa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hòa hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase machines for tailor-made and clothing repair services

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Sek is married and the conscientious mother of five children. She is very hardworking and honest in her daily work. For more than 30 years she has been growing rice and getting support from her husband.  Most of her children also help her with the business. 

For additional income, Sek has been involved in a recycling business but presently she is experiencing financial difficulties with no working capital to invest in it. To ensure the sustainability of the business, Sek decided to ask for some funds from Kiva, through HKL, to keep as working capital for the purchase of recycled materials. This will be her third loan with our firm. She is very grateful to all our lenders.

loans.use: to keep as working capital for the purchase of recycled materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase firewood for resale.

loans.name: 3.2.141.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thạch works in agriculture growing food. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future. Thạch is 40 years old and she is married with two children. Thạch is the group leader of the 3.2.141.Thiệu Vận solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2003, Thạch joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thạch  has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thạch has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thạch faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Thạch  hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: 3.13.thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa, a 45-year-old married mother of two, is the group leader of the 3.13.Thiệu Đô solidarity group, which consists of three members. Hoa lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, where she has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than ten years. Her main business hardship is insufficient capital.

In 2011, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Having already received and repaid two loans, she is requesting a new one to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. With her additional profits, Hoa hopes to enhance her enterprise, be able to buy more business supplies and equipment, and remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 33 años de edad; es madre soltera y vive en su propia casa junto a sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea darles una buena educación y mejor calidad de vida. Carmen, es una mujer muy esforzada con los deberes que siempre realiza como rutina; durante las mañanas ella se levanta muy temprano para dirigirse a su campo de cultivo que durante 10 años logró obtener para el beneficio de su familia. Ella siempre esta al tanto de los gastos que efectúan sus hijos sobre todo en la temporada escolar; por ello siempre esta al tato de su producción de las plantas de cacao y coca; sus cosechas lo lleva a vender a los centros acopiadores quienes le remuneran buenas ganancias por cada kilo. Con la ganancia de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos de sus hijos; es por ello que acude a las oficinas de MFP para solicitar un préstamo que ayude a cumplir con sus planes de trabajo. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP y se compromete a seguir siendo puntual como en el anterior préstamo que obtuvo. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable y solidaria. Con el préstamo solicitado de 3.000 nuevos soles comprará  agroquímicos para mantener fértil a su producción y con el resto contratará a jornaleros para que la apoyen.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 33, is a single mother.  She lives in her own house with her three beloved children.  She wishes to give them a good education and a better quality of life.

Carmen is a very hard-working woman who always does the following like a routine.  In the mornings she gets up very early to go to her land where she grows crops.  In ten years she managed to get the land in order to benefit her family.

She is always up to date on the expenses that affect her children, most of all during the school season.  That is why she is always up to date with the production of her cocoa and coconut plants.  She takes her harvest to sell to the storage warehouses.  They pay her good earnings for each kilo.  With her income from the harvests she manages to pay her children’s expenses.

This is why she comes to the MFP offices to request a loan to help complete her work plans.  This will be her second loan with MFP.  She pledges to continue being punctual as she was with the previous loan that she had.  In her communal bank she is a responsible and supportive member.  She will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy agrochemicals to keep her crops fertile.  With the rest she will hire day workers to help her.

loans.use: to buy agrochemicals and to hire day workers.

loans.name: 3.2.142.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương operates a food stall selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables and resell them. Hương is 34 years old and she is married with two children. Hương is the group leader of the 3.2.142.Thiệu Vận solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

In 2006, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

 Hương hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment with her business profit, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and resell them.

loans.name: Sandra Jaqueline

texts.es:
La joven Sandra   de 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, ella vive en casa de sus familiares junto con su esposo quien trabaja para apoyar a su familia, una de sus hijas estudia en la escuela, ella vive en San Lorenzo, Valle.
Sandra se dedica a la venta de ropa usada que vende de manera ambulante en los barrios y colonias de san Lorenzo, sale casi todos los días a vender sus productos para sacar adelante a su familia.
Sandra solicita 5,000.00 lempiras para compra  de ropa usada como pantalones, camisas, blusas, y ropa de cama.
Con las ganancias de las ventas pretende comprar más productos para así atender a más clientes y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Sandra es hacer crecer su negocio y que un día su negocio sea auto sostenible para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Sandra is 33 years old. She is married and has two children who are her dependents. She lives in the home of her relatives, with her husband who works to support their family. One of her children is studying. They lives in San Lorenzo, Valle. 

Sandra has a business selling used clothing. She sells going house to house in the neighborhoods of San Lorenzo. She goes out to sell almost everyday. so that she can help her family get ahead. 

She has requested 5,000.00 lempiras to buy used clothing like pants, shirts and blouses as well as bedding. 

With her earnings from her sales she plans on purchasing more clothing so she can sell to more customers, and by doing so increase her income. Sandra's dream is to expand her business and that one day her business will be independently sustainable to help give her children a better life. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts and bedding for her business.

loans.name: Doncellas Group

texts.es:
Doncellas es un grupo solidario que esta en su tercer ciclo con esta institución. Ellas son un grupo pequeño compuesto por 6 mujeres y están muy a gusto con el grupo como está. Ellas ya habían estado en otros grupos con otras instituciones antes y se conocen muy bien desde hace 5 años. Son vecinas y tratan de escoger muy bien a la gente que entra a su grupo, ya que no les gusta que nadie les quede mal con los pagos. 

Karla Elizabeth es una de las integrantes de este grupo. Hace 3 años, Karla decidió comenzar a vender abarrotes y joyería de plata en mercados rodantes. Karla solicitó el crédito para poder adquirir más mercancía y así ofrecerles a sus clientes una variedad más amplia de productos. Ella tiene 27 años y está casada. Tienen 2 pequeños niños, de 8 y 4 años. Karla aspira a seguir adelante para ver superarse a sus hijos. Desea hacer crecer su negocio poco a poco para algún día, poder poner una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Doncellas is a solidarity group that is in its third loan cycle with this institution. They are a small group composed of 6 women and are very satisfied with the group as it is.  They have already been in other groups with other institutions before and have known each other well for 5 years.  They are neighbors and try to choose the people who enter their group well, since they don't like that anyone is bad with the payments. 

Karla Elizabeth is one of the members of this group. Three years ago, Karla decided to start to sell groceries and silver jewelry in street markets. Karla requested a loan to be able to acquire more merchandise and in that way offer her clients a wider variety of products. 

She is 27 years old and is married.  They have 2 small boys, 8 and 4 years old.  Karla aspires to get ahead to see her sons advance. She wants to make her business grow little by little so that one day, she will be able to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Margaritas Dos Group

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Modesta esta casada, tiene 38 años de edad, cursó el tercer años de educación primaria, tiene 1 hija, ella se dedica al comercio a la atención a una tienda en general, inició este negocio siendo una mini-tienda y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de productos para venta en la tienda, jugos, cereales, aguas gaseosas, golosinas, leche, embutidos, etc. Las demás integrantes se dedica a la crianza de animales, confección de prendas,  y a la atención de tienda de consumo diario, espera en el futuro tener una abarrotería.
texts.en:
Gloria Modesta is 38 years old and married.  She has a third grade education and has one daughter.  [Gloria] runs a general store and began this business as a mini-store.  She has six years’ experience. 

She organizes a group so that they can request loans and she will use this one to buy inventory such as juices, cereals, soft drinks, snacks, milk, sausages, etc. for her store.  The other members raise livestock, make clothing, and run stores.  She hopes to open a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store.

loans.name: 3.8. 143.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoa has a service business farming food. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Thoa is 39 years old and she is married with two children. Thoa is the group leader of the 3.8. 143.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

In 2010, Thoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thoa has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Thoa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thoa hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es:
Eliza, es una mujer alegre y cauta; tiene 37 años; vive en su propia casa junto a sus dos hijos Alfredo de 13 y LLeyc de 06 años a quienes desea dedicarles todo su esfuerzo. Eliza, tiene un negocio en su propia casa; donde los habitantes  de su localidad acuden a su tienda de abarrotes para elaborar  sus compras del día. Esta actividad empezó a realizar hace 10 años;  desde que se  separo de su cónyuge y tenia que ver la forma de poder educar a sus hijos. Ella continuamente esta al pendiente de que su tienda no pueda quedar sin abarrote; ya que es la forma de poder solventar los gastos de sus hijos. Por lo tanto con el préstamo solicitado realizará sus compras necesarias para abastecerse de productos. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos sean profesionales y tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Este será su crédito número 06 con MFP; se siente muy contenta por el apoyo que le brindan. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable. 
Con el préstamo comprará, saco de arroz, variedades de conservas, fideos, leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
Eliza is a happy and cautious woman. She is 37 years old and lives in her own home with her two children, Alfredo who is 13 years old and Leyc who is 6 years old. All that she does, she does for her children. 

Eliza has a business, a small store, which she runs out of her home. The people who live in the area come to her grocery store to make their daily purchases. She started this business 10 years ago, when she separated from her husband and had to find a way to pay for the education of her children. She always makes sure that her store remains well stocked, since it is her way of providing for the expenses of her children. She has requested a loan to be able to make purchases to restock her store. Her greatest wish is that her children will become professionals and have a better quality of life. This is the 6th loan she has taken out through MFP; she is very happy for the support she has been provided. She is a responsible member of her communal bank.

With the loan she will buy a sack of rice, canned food, noodles, milk and other things.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, canned food, noodles and milk.

loans.name: Eliberta

texts.es:
Doña Eliberta, es casada, de 39 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos que dependen de ella de edades 15,14,9 y 8 años dos de ellos van al colegio y dos a la escuela de su comunidad, ella vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña Eliberta se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de pollo frito, tamales de pollo, pastelitos, Tajaditas de Mínimo Verde y golosinas.
 Doña Eliberta solicita su segundo préstamo a PRISMA por la cantidad de 13,000.00 lempiras para compra de refrescos, verduras, pollo y aceites.
Doña Eliberta con las ganancias que le genere la inversión del préstamo pretende terminar de construir el local que necesita para atender mejor a sus clientes.
El sueño de Doña Eliberta es que sus hijos se le gradúen de la universidad y que su vivienda sea mejor.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Eliberta is 39 and married.  She has four children, ages 15, 14, 9, and 8 who depend on her.  Two attend school and the other two attend the local elementary school.  She lives in the city of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.

Eliberta has been selling fried chicken, chicken tamales, little cakes, fried green bananas, and snacks.  She is asking for a second loan, through PRISMA, in the amount of 13,000 lempiras, in order to buy soft drinks, vegetables, chicken, and cooking oil.

She will use the profits from this investment to finish building her food stall, which she needs to be able to better serve her customers.

Eliberta’s dreams are for her children to graduate from university and to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Reina tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos de edades 16,14 y 10 años, todos sus hijos estudian y su esposo trabaja para apoyar los gastos en el hogar, ella vive en una comunidad de san Lorenzo.
Doña Reina Tiene un negocio de pulpería ubicado en un local de su casa, ella ahí atiende a sus clientes que le visitan a diario a comprar los productos que ella comercializa.
Doña Reina desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de  ropa, usada y abarrotería como manteca jugos, refrescos, Maseca, jugos, pollo, etc.
Doña Reina con las ganancias del negocio pretende que sus hijos tengan el estudio necesario para que se puedan graduarse de la universidad y también el negocio crecerá.
El sueño de Doña Reina es que sus hijos se gradúen de la universidad y así tengan mejores oportunidades.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Reina is 39 years old, married, and has three children, ages, 16, 14, and 10.  All attend school and her husband works to support the home.  She lives in San Lorenzo and has a general store that she runs out of her home.  There she tends to her customers who visit her daily to buy the products that she sells.

Reina wants to invest the money from this loan into second-hand clothing and groceries, such as lard, juices, soft drinks, corn flour, juices, chicken, etc.  She wants to use the profits from the business to make sure that her children can graduate from university and also to grow the business.

Reina’s dream is for her children to graduate from university so that they will have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store.

loans.name: 3.8. 145.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hỡi has a service business repairing electronics. She is requesting a loan to purchase electrical and electronic devices to resell.

Hỡi is 47 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the 3.8. 145.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with three dependents.

In 2009, Hỡi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hỡi has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Hỡi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hỡi hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase electrical and electronic devices to resell.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma, es una mujer empeñosa; tiene 54 años, es esposa de Juan de Dios de 66 años y fruto de ese amor tienen tres hijos a quienes estiman. Irma y su esposo; se dedican al cuidado de sus plantas de cacao, que durante 20 años lograron obtener. Su labor empieza a partir de la 05:00 a.m.; cuya labor es ver la producción de los cultivos que producen; los tiempos más difíciles para ambos es  en los tiempos de lluvia;  ya que entre las plantas de cacao llegan a crecer malezas que interrumpen el avance de su siembra. Es por ello que siempre están al pendiente; en los tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos mayores y de algunos jornales, quienes ayudan a cosechar  los frutos de manera rápida, para que lo comercialice en las asociaciones que compran los granos a buenos precios. Su mayor anhelo es cultivar plantas de café y coca; pero por ahora desea fumigar sus plantas para que obtenga una buena producción en su próxima cosecha. Este es su crédito número 01 con MFP y se siente contenta por saber que contará con el apoyo financiero. En su banco comunal es una socia agradecida por darle la oportunidad de trabajar con personas responsables y solidarias 
Con el préstamo solicitado comprará insecticidas y abono para realizar el mantenimiento de su cultivo.
texts.en:
Irma is a hard working woman. She is 45 years old and her husband, Juan de Dios, is 66 years old. Together they have three children whom are very loved. Irma and her husband are cacao farmers, which they have been doing for the past 20 years. They start working at 5:00 a.m., caring for their crops. The most difficult time for them is during the rainy season, because between their cacao plants grow weeds which interfere with the growth of their plants. This is why it is important that they provide continuous care to their crops.  During harvest time they have the help of their oldest children, as well as hired workers, who help pick the fruit quickly, so that they are able to sell to the agricultural associations that buy cacao at a good price.

Their greatest dream is to have crops of coffee and coca, but for now what they want to do is fumigate their plants in order to insure a good crop in their next harvest. 

This is the first loan she has taken out through MFP and she is happy to know she has financial support. As a member of her communal bank, she is thankful to have been given the opportunity to work with responsible and united individuals. 

With the loan she has requested, she will buy insecticides and fertilizer to be able to provide maintenance to her crops.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila, de 35 años de edad; es una mujer cabal y hacendosa; vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Juan de 44 años y su único hijo Álvaro de 11 años  a quien desean brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Lucila, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, leche, conservas, golosinas, entre otros; su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa de su localidad. Esta actividad lleva realizando hace 06 años y comenta que su trabajo es muy fácil. Su esposo le ayuda en los tiempos que esta libre; es decir; cuando se va a su campo de cultivo; los ahorros que aportan ambos les sirven para la educación de su hijo y gastos de su hogar. Con el tiempo anhela que su tienda se vuelva una tienda mayorista; pero por el momento quiere aumentar productos para su tienda. Este es su crédito numero 06 con MFP; y se siente contenta por seguir contando con el apoyo de los financistas. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable y puntual en sus cuotas de pago. 
Con el préstamo solicitado, proporcionará productos para incrementar en su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Lucila is 35 years old and is a full and industrious lady.  She lives in a home of her own, along with her husband, 44 year old Juan, and her only son, 11 year old Alvaro, to whom they want to provide a better quality of life.  Lucila sells groceries, such as rice, sugar, milk, preserves, and snacks among other things.  Her business is located at home.  She’s been doing this for six years and says that her work is easy.  Her husband helps her when he’s free, that is to say when he goes to work his crops.  The income that they both generate is for their son’s education and household expenses.  In time she hopes that her store grows to be a large one, but for now she wants to increase her store’s inventory.  This will be her 6th loan through MFP and she feels glad to be able to count on financial support.  She’s a responsible member of her communal bank and makes her payments on time.

She will use the money from this loan to increase her store’s inventory.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
La señora Ana Lucia, tiene 21 años de edad, se dedica a la crianza de animales y al comercio a la venta de ropa para niños, bebés y adultos, inicio este negocio cuando contaba con un pequeño capital y hasta ahora lleva 6 años de experiencia. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio surtido y con mayores ventas.

Decide organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo a ASDIR para la compra de mercaderías: suéteres, playeras, chumpas, bufandas, blusas, beberos, calcetines para bebes, guantes, etc, y así poder contar con más variedad en sus ventas, y cumplir con su sueño de ver un negocio mejor y más surtido. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la producción agrícola, venta de calzado, venta de trastos, crianza de animales y al comercio.
texts.en: Ana Lucia is 21 and raises animals and sells clothing for babies, children and adults.  She began this business with a small amount of capital and now has 6 years of experience.  She hopes in the future to have a well-stocked business with increased sales.  She decided to organize a group to apply for a loan from ASDIR to buy merchandise such as: sweaters, shirts, jackets, scarves, blouses, children's items, socks and gloves, etc. so as to have varied items for sale and increase business.  Some members of the group raise crops or animals, while others sell shoes, used items or other products,

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Un gran carisma es lo que siempre ha identificado a Blanca, quien con mucho esfuerzo ha tenido que superar grandes adversidades que le ha presentado la vida. Blanca tiene 6 hijos y es madre soltera debido a que su esposo murió hace un tiempo y la dejó encargada del cuidado de sus hijos, por lo que se vio en la obligación de crear una fuente de ingresos que le permitiera estar al cuidado de sus hijos al mismo tiempo que a la atención de su negocio. Fue así como montó una tienda donde ofrece toda clase de licores, snack y dulces para sus clientes, y de esta manera genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Gracias a la buena atención que ofrece en su negocio, Blanca ha podido captar un gran número de clientes y esto le ha permitido tener muy buenos niveles de ventas. Con el ánimo de aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, Blanca busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de licores, snack y dulces para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos.

Blanca espera que de esta manera su negocio siga creciendo y sus ingresos aumenten para poder ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Blanca sueña con tener un gran negocio que le genere grandes ingresos para su hogar y poder mejorarles la calidad de vida a sus 6 hijos que hasta la fecha han tenido que pasar por muchas dificultades en su vida.
texts.en:
Blanca has always been described as having charisma. She is someone who, with great effort, has overcome great obstacles in her life. Blanca has 6 children and is a single mother, due to the fact that her husband passed away a while ago, leaving her to care for their children. As a result, she needed a way to make income which would allow her to care for her children and at the same time run a business. It was for these reasons that she opened a store where she offers different types of liquors, snacks and treats to her customers. From this business she is able to generate the necessary income to sustain her family. Thanks to the good service she offers through her business, she has built a good customer base, which allows her to have high number of sales. With the motivation to increase the variety of products she has to offer to her customers, Blanca is seeking a loan that will provide her with the possibility to purchase liquor, snacks and treats to offer to her customers a better variety of products. 

Blanca hopes that in this way her business will continue to grow, and that her income will increase so that she will be able to offer her children a better quality of life. Blanca's dream is to have a big business that generates a large income for her household, allowing her to improve the quality of life for her 6 children. Up to this point she has had many difficulties in her life.

loans.use: to buy liqour, snacks and sweets to offer her customers a better variety of products.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухайё получает кредит в первые на покупку детских вещей с Истаравшана. Она торгует на рынке почти год и сейчас весений сезон она планирует привезти весенний товар для детей. У нее 3 детей, ее муж находиться в Российской Федерации на заработках. В бизнесе поддерживает свекор. В начинании бизнеса помогла тетя, она находила ей хорошие товары и рассказывала все секреты  товароведения. Получает кредит для расширения бизнеса , она хочет привезти весенний товар для дальнейшей реализации.
texts.en: Muhayo is taking out her first loan, intended for buying children’s clothing from Istaravshan. She has been selling at the market for about a year. With the spring season starting, she plans to bring spring clothes for children. She has three children; her husband is  currently in the Russian Federation as a migrant worker. Her father-in-law supports her in her business. Her aunt helped her launch this business: she would find quality goods and shared all tricks of the retail buyer trade. Muhayo is  taking out this loan in order to expand her business; she would like to bring spring clothes for  resale.

loans.use: to buy a spring assortment of children's clothes.

loans.name: Elsy Macias

texts.es:
Elsy siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y esto le ha permitido superar grandes adversidades que le ha presentado la vida. Elsy se encuentra casada y tiene 1 hijo a quien siempre le ha querido ofrecer una buena calidad de vida, por lo que trabaja fuertemente en su negocio para poder cumplir este cometido. Elsy aprendió a trabajar la venta de gaseosas, snack y dulces desde hace ya un tiempo, y hace poco aprendió la preparación de comidas rápidas. Con estas dos actividades ha podido generar ingresos con los cuales puede contribuir económicamente al sostenimiento de su hogar y gracias a esto su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. La mayor dificultad que tiene Elsy es la falta de capital para poder responder a la demanda del mercado, por lo que muchas veces ha tenido que desperdiciar grandes oportunidades de que su negocio crezca por el poco capital para comprar los productos e insumos que requiere en su negocio. Es por esto que Elsy busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de gaseosas, snack, dulces e insumos para la preparación de sus comidas rápidas y seguir aumentando la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

Elsy espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá atender las necesidades de sus clientes que antes no podía satisfacer por la falta de productos e insumos. Además, Elsy espera que su hijo y su esposo puedan acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas que le permitan progresar más fácilmente.
texts.en:
Elsy has always been known as a hard worker, which has allowed her to overcome great obstacles that have been in her life. Elsy is married and has one child, to whom she has always wanted to offer a higher good quality of life, which is why she works hard in her business to be able to succeed in this task. Elsy learned the business of selling sodas, snacks, and treats a long time ago, and just recently learned how to prepare fast foods. With these two economic activities she has been able to generate income with which she contributes economically to the household expenses. Thanks to this her family can enjoy a better quality of life. 

The biggest difficulty Elsy has is the lack of capital to be able to respond to the demands of her customers. Many times she has had to miss out on great opportunities that would have allowed her business to grow, because she didn't have the capital to be able to buy the products and supplies that she needed. It is for this reason that she has sought out a loan, to provide to her the opportunity to make purchases of sodas, snacks, sweets and supplies for the preparation of her fast foods, as well as to continue increasing the variety of products she has to offer to her customers.      

Elsy hopes that in this way she will be able to increase her income considerably, which will allow her to attend to the needs of her customers, which before she was not able to do as a result of lack of products and supplies.
