Debido a que la entidad estatal que le ha dado el aval para realizar la actividad, le ha exigido realizar algunas mejoras locativas, Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a realizar mejoras locativas en su hogar infantil para seguir teniendo el aval de la entidad del estado que le permite realizar su actividad.

Maria espera que de esta manera siga operando su hogar infantil y pueda seguir cuidando los niños que por los oficios de sus madres requieren de una persona que les brinde la atención durante gran parte del día. Además, Maria espera que de esta manera siga teniendo un reconocimiento entre las personas de su sector y esto le haga tener mayores clientes para su negocio. Maria sueña con tener un gran jardín infantil con un mayor número de niños y poder seguir trabajando con la niñez que siempre ha querido.
texts.en:
María has always been known as a person who has great charisma and a lot of empathy for children.  This was why she decided to set up her own business where she takes care of children and offers them education and nourishment when their mothers require a substitute mother during a big part of the day.  María is recognized by the government institution that provides for the care and protection of children, and thanks to this she has had recognition.

Her home child care center is located in her house, where she has two large rooms to take care of the children.

Because the government institution that gives her the backing to do her job has required her to make some improvements, María is looking that a loan will give her the opportunity to make improvements to her home child care center to continue having the backing.

María hopes that in this way she will continue running her child care center and be able to continue caring for the children who need to be with a person who takes care of them for a large part of the day because of their mothers' jobs.  In addition, María hopes that she will continue being recognized among the people of her area so she will have more customers for her business.

María dreams about having a large kindergarten with a greater number of children and being able to continue working with childhood as she always has wanted.

loans.use: to make improvements on her home child care center to continue having the support of the government institution that allows her to do her job.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maribel le esta haciendo falta la losa al frente de la casa y la elaboración de barda trasera. Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar el material, que es arena, cemento, varilla, block y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora a su casa. 
Doña Maribel trabaja en la vecina ciudad de Laredo Texas y su esposo es empleado de una agencia, en el aria de contabilidad. Son las fuentes de ingresos que tiene para darles lo mejor a sus dos hijos pequeños que tiene y que su patrimonio este en buenas condiciones y que sea seguro para ellos. 
La señora Maribel ya ha tenido un crédito con KIVA el cual fue para mejorar su vivienda, es pera contar con su cooperación para este crédito.
texts.en:
Maribel's home is missing a concrete slab at the front of the house and a rear wall. She is requesting a loan to buy materials (sand, cement, rods, and concrete blocks) and to pay the person who will make these improvements to her house.

Maribel works in the neighboring city of Laredo, Texas, and her husband is employed by an agency where he works in accounting. These are the sources of income they have for providing their two small children with the best and for ensuring that their legacy is safe and in good condition for them.

Maribel has had a loan with Kiva before, which was also for home improvements. She hopes she can count on your cooperation with this loan.

loans.use: to add a concrete slab in front of her house and a wall in back

loans.name: Kenny

texts.es:
Kenny, de 24 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y con muchos deseos de superación, así como alegre y amable. Es soltero y sin hijos, vive en compañía de su padre, su madre y sus 03 hermanos Deysi de 29 años, Yen de 22 años y Aron de 19 años de edad, habitando cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Kenny es la transporte de pasajeros para lo cual cuenta con un automóvil usado que compró con sus ahorros en una oportunidad que se presento a bajo costo  hace 2 años. Para realizar su trabajo  se levanta muy de temprano para buscar sus pasajeros por las calles de la ciudad realizando su jornada hasta el medio día, hora en que regresa a descansar, y en las tardes se dedica a sus estudios técnicos.
Considera a su actividad rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su actividad ya que puede manejar sus tiempos libres y dedicarse a los estudios, y comenta se decidió por ésta actividad por la necesidad de tener los ingresos económicos ya que tenia muchas necesidades y gastos que no podía solventar, ahora se siente más tranquilo y cómodo ya que tiene un ingreso permanente y cuenta con más tiempo libre. Por lo contrario comenta que le incomoda un poco cuando llueve muy seguido ya que esto dificulta su trabajo, pero eso no lo desanima y continúa trabajando. Por tanto tiene planes de terminar sus estudios superiores y crear su propia empresa de transportes. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP.  Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por tanto, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores y tener  un buen record crediticio. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, tiene planes de invertir en mantenimiento de su automóvil y en la compra de repuestos como llantas y otros, para así tener operativo su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en: Kenny is a hard-working 24-year-old with a strong desire to move up in life. He is also happy and friendly. He is single, doesn't have any children and lives comfortably with his parents and his three siblings: Deysi, 29; Yen, 22; and Aron, 19. Kenny makes a living transporting passengers with an automobile he purchased with his savings when a low-cost opportunity presented itself two years ago. He gets up very early in search of customers on the city streets, works until he takes a mid-day break, and then dedicates himself to technical school in the afternoon. He considers his work lucrative because of the good profits he makes. He enjoys the activity because he can manage his free time and focus on his studies. He says that he decided on this work out of the need to earn income because he had a lot of needs that he couldn't afford. Now he feels more calm and comfortable because he has steady income and more free time. However, he tells us that it bothers him a bit when it rains a lot because it makes it difficult to work, but it doesn't discourage him. He plans to finish his higher education and start his own transportation company. This will be his second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he hopes your collaboration will help solidify his plans. He promises to make his payments on time like he did with his previous loan, and he has a good credit history. With the money he is requesting, he plans to invest in the maintenance of his automobile and to purchase spare parts like tires and other items, so he can keep his vehicle in good shape.

loans.use: to perform vehicle maintenance and purchase tires.

loans.name: Noua Marcelline

texts.fr: Noua Marcelline est mariée, âgée de 29 ans et mère d'un enfant. Elle commercialise des ustensiles, des produits corporels et des bijoux. En vue d'achalander son stock et d'avoir un grand nombre de profit elle a sollicité un financement auprès de Finadev afin que les marges bénéficiaires puissent lui permettre de supporter les charges de son enfants.
texts.en:
Noua Marcelline is 29 years old, married, and the mother of one child.  

She sells utensils, body products and some jewelry.  In order to increase her stock of goods and her profits, she has requested a loan from Finadev.  She hopes that the profit margins will enable her to take care of her child's needs.

loans.use: to buy one set of plates, one set of iceboxes and one dozen body products.

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es:
Sin un gran capital Paula inició su negocio de salón de belleza y servicios de cosmetología, con el cual ha venido generando los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento y el sostenimiento de su hijo. Paula en un principio abrió su negocio ofreciendo solamente el servicio de corte y cepillado del cabello, pero comenzó a estudiar cosmetología y posteriormente logró adquirir equipos de masajes y así fue aumentando la oferta de servicios que ofrece a sus clientes. Gracias a esto, ha podido captar un gran número de clientes y su negocio es muy reconocido por el buen servicio que ofrece. Paula, con este negocio, le ha permitido a su hijo de 2 años tener una buena calidad de vida sin importar que su padre los haya abandonado desde hace un tiempo, y es por esto que Paula quiere seguir aumentando las ventas de su negocio y ofrecer mejor calidad de vida en su hogar. Para la compra de un nuevo equipo de masajes, Paula busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de un equipo de ultracavitación con el cual pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio de masajes a sus clientes.

Paula espera que de esta manera sus clientes aumenten de manera considerable, pues ya podrá ofrecer un servicio completo con el cual sus clientes quedarán más satisfechos y tendrán como referencia su negocio. Además, Paula espera con mayores ingresos ofrecer a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y ofrecerle mayores oportunidades económicas para su progreso. Paula sueña con tener un gran centro de estética, ubicada en un local propio y en el cual pueda ofrecer más empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Without a lot of capital, Paula started her beauty salon and cosmetology service business, with which she has been generating the necessary income to support herself and her child.  Paula opened her business offering only cutting and brushing hair, but she began to study cosmetology and later managed to acquire massage equipment, and so she expanded the services she offered to her customers.  Thanks to this she has been able to attract a large number of customers and her business is very well known for her good customer service.  

With this business, Paula has given her two-year-old son a good quality of life despite the fact that his father had abandoned them a long time ago.  This is why Paula wants to continue increasing her sales and offering a better quality of life in her home.

For the purchase of new massage equipment, Paula is looking that a loan gives her the possibility to buy an ultracavitation machine with which she can give better massage service to her customers.

Paula hopes that in this way her clientele will increase considerably because she will be able to offer complete service with which her customers will be more satisfied and will refer her business. 

In addition, Paula hopes that, with the greater income, she can offer her son a better quality of life and better economic opportunities for his progress.  Paula dreams about having a big beauty center, located in her own place and where she can offer more employment for the neediest people.

loans.use: to buy an ultracavitation machine to give better massage service to her customers.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor Guadalupe, tiene 62 años de edad, casado, vive en una aldea de Santa Cruz de Yojoa junto a su hija menor de 10 años de edad, sus otros hijos son mayores de edad y están independizados.

Don Guadalupe tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura, hace dos años comenzó con el cultivo de fruta  como ser Lichas (nombre científico rambután)  y  hortalizas como el  cilantro. Anteriormente se ha dedicado al cultivo del pataste. Se motivo por este cultivo por la alta demanda que hay en el mercado. Tiene un área de terreno de una manzana cultivada de esta fruta y parcelas de cilantro, le dedica 5 horas diarias para darle mantenimiento.
Desde el año 2001 empezó a solicitar préstamos a ODEF, lleva 34 ciclos de préstamos, el actual es por 15,000.00 Lempiras y los va invertir en compra de fertilizantes para darle un buen mantenimiento y lograr buenas cosechas del cultivo de  fruta y cilantro. 
Su meta es seguir trabajando con este cultivo, mejorar la producción y sus ingresos para su solvencia económica.
texts.en: Guadalupe is 62 years old, married, and lives in a village of Santa Cruz de Yojoa together with his youngest daughter who is 10 years old. His other children are adults and independent. Guadalupe has made a living in agriculture for many years. Two years ago he started planting fruit like lychee (rambutan) and garden produce like cilantro. Previously, he had made his living planting pataste [a long green vegetable, similar to zucchini]. He was motivated to plant this crop due to the high market demand. He has a plot of land of one manzana [about 1.72 acres] planted with this fruit and plots of cilantro and spends five hours a day maintaining it In 2001 he began requesting loans from ODEF and he has had 34 loans. His current loan is for 15,000 Lempiras and he will use it to buy fertilizers to well maintain his crops and produce a good harvest from the crops of fruit and cilantro. Hi goal is to continue working with this crop and to improve his production and his income so as to be financially solvent.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to maintain his fruit crop (lychees or rambutans, and cilantro).

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Patricia le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior. Solicita el préstamo para comprar el material que es cemento, arena, pintura especia para el exterior y que pueda proteger su casa de los del clima como es de las lluvias. 
Doña Patricia es viuda y actualmente vive sola, pero cuenta con la ayuda económica de sus hijos, a un así la señora Patricia esta trabajando en una casa partículas, haciendo la limpieza. 
Desea mejorar su patrimonio y que este en mejores condiciones y proteger se de enfermedades.
texts.en:
Patricia's home is lacking the finishing touches to its exterior. She is requesting a loan to buy materials like cement, sand, and special paint for the exterior that will be able to protect her home from the weather such as the rains. 

Patricia is a widow and she currently lives alone, though she does have the financial support of her children. Despite this, Patricia is working cleaning in private homes.

She wants to improve her estate and hopes to be in a better condition while protecting herself from disease.

loans.use: to do the finishing touches to the exterior of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand her business and buy sweaters for resale.

loans.name: Nathalie Rachelle

texts.fr:
Nathalie est une jeune femme agée de 29 ans, mariée mère de 5 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 17 ans et 6 mois, quatre de ses enfants vont déjà à l'école. Le premier qui as 17 ans n'est pas d'elle mais de son époux. Elle a un petit secrétariat, sa clientèle devient de plus en plus nombreuse alors elle sollicite un crédit pour agrandir sa structure en ajoutant les ordinateurs et le matériel bureautique pour pouvoir la satisfaire et augmenter sa production.

Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront non seulement d'ajouter le petit matériel bureautique, mais aussi d'aider son époux dans les dépenses quotidiennes et surtout une partie de la scolarisation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Nathalie is a young woman of 29 years. She is married and the mother of five children whose ages range from 17 years to 6 months. Four of her children already attend school.

She has a small secretarial business. Her clientele is growing so she is requesting a loan to expand her business by adding computers and office equipment. This will allow her to meet the needs of her customers and expand her services.

The profits from this loan will not only enable her to add small office equipment but will also help Nathalie assist her husband with daily expenses and especially with some of the school fees for their children.

loans.use: to purchase computers and office equipment.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 38-year-old divorced woman. She is supporting her children, who live with her in her parents’ house.

To be able to support her family, Siham has been doing a small retail business selling blankets, toys and make-up products. 

She now wants to increase her capital by having a larger quantity of the products to be able to provide her children with good education and good life conditions, and for that has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to increase her capital by having a larger quantity of toys, blankets, and other consumer goods

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia, age 51, married and with three children, still wants to alleviate her family out of poverty. The family lives at Ugac Sur. Herminia operates a small store in front of their house to generate an income. She had been doing it for over three years now. Her spouse is a construction worker. Her three children are attending school and in need of daily allowances. She is thankful for the income from her business.

She is now asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy milk, coffee, eggs and soft drinks to sell in her store. In the future, she would like to have a good income from her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy milk, coffee, eggs and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Novalyn

texts.en:
Novalyn is a small entrepreneur selling snacks to the people in her village. She is selling siomai (meatballs made of shrimp or pork, wrapped and usually steamed). She buys ingredients at the public market to cook and sell in the afternoon. She usually generates P2,000 each month and it goes for daily meals for the family.

She would like to improve her sales, so she is asking for an additional capital of P8,000 to buy wrappers, cooking oil and ingredients used in cooking siomai to sell. In the future, though she generates only minimal income, she is hoping to increase it to save funds to use when emergency arises.

loans.use: to buy wrappers, cooking oil and ingredients used in cooking siomai to sell.

loans.name: Donata

texts.en:
Donata is a retail store owner at Ugac Sur. She lives with her spouse, who is a carpenter. They have three children. She has been in her business for almost eight years. 

She wanted to increase her product offerings, so she is now asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs and shampoo to sell. In the future, she aims for business expansion to gain consistent profits from her small business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria and her spouse live simply at Ugac Sur with their only child. Francisco, her spouse, provides motorcycle transport services to the people in their village. They usually earn about P3,000 each month and the income goes for meals and bills at home. 

She is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy gasoline and tires for the motorcycle. This will help operate the business continuously and earn more income from it. She supports her spouse very well and she knows they will achieve financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and tires for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 43 years old, married, and has two children attending school. She is managing a small store in the village where they live. She started her business six years ago and earns about P4,000 each month.

She would like to increase her sales, so she is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy cooking oil, bottles of vinegar, biscuits, and sardines to sell in her store. She will be very happy if this loan will be granted to her as a way of a business improvement. She hopes to earn good profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, bottles of vinegar, biscuits, and sardines to sell in her store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a supportive mother and wife to her husband. Her husband Roger provides motorcycle transport services to the people in their village. They usually earn about a minimum of P350 daily and it goes for meals and allowances for the children. She hopes to keep ensuring safe travel for their passengers, so she would like a loan to maintain their business.
 
She is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy tires, mirrors and gasoline for the motorcycle. In the future, she hopes to achieve a good daily profit from the business.

loans.use: to buy tires, mirrors and gasoline for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is engaged in a hog-raising business that primarily involves hogs for breeding. It is a business she started several years ago. Now, she needs to increase her business, and this is why she is taking out a loan of 10,000 PHP that she will use to buy feed, vaccines, and additional hogs to raise. This business helps Susana, because it's the only source of income she has to raise her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and additional hogs to raise.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Hog-raising is the chosen business of Rowena, a 38 year old who is married and has four children. She lives with her family in the village of San Roque. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years. Right now she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase feed and vaccine for the proper growth of her hog-raising business. She believes that her sacrifices will lead her to reach her goal, which is to increase her profit and save some for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccine for the proper growth of her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s animal skin sales business. Her husband buys the animal skins from butchers and sells them to different factories who use them to make different products. With the loan investment, he will buy a larger quantity of animal skins for reselling and earn more profits. 

Shameem herself is a seamstress, sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very creative in her work and can prepare clothes according to the latest trend and fashion. She is the mother of a son and a daughter. Her son is studying while her daughter remains at home and helps her in her routine tasks. She is very hopeful that by investing the loan into her husband’s business, her husband will be able to expand it further and it will help Shameem and her family to live better financial life. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shameem.

loans.use: To buy animal skins for selling.

loans.name: Fiyaz Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Fiyaz bibi has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her son’s fruit selling business. He is a very hardworking and honest person by nature. He visits different streets & areas on his four-wheeled cart for selling the fruit. He handles a good clientele base, and due to his fresh & quality fruit, he makes good sales every month. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits for selling to his clients and earn more profits. 

Fiyaz herself is a very good mother and housewife, and provides full support to her family with her efforts. She is very confident that the loan will bring positive changes to her son’s business and will improve his income.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for selling.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en:
Zoraida is a responsible and loving mother. She is 42 years of age and married to Ronnie, who is a farmer within the community where they live. Among her six children, three of them are married, two are still studying and the youngest is still an infant.

Zoraida has operated her store for two years. She is grateful because she is able to earn about P3,000 a month. She uses her income to buy the feed supplies for her raised hogs, for her children's allowances and for their daily needs. However, the income intended for re-stocking her store is no longer enough.

Because of this situation, she is requesting a loan amount of P10,000, which will allow her to buy more merchandise. This would mean a lot of her, most especially in sustaining her family's needs and maintaining her store.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 54 years old. She lives in Pokr Vedi village with her husband and children. Susanna's husband is a taxi driver. Susanna's two daughters are 22 and 21 years old, and her two sons are 21 and 23 years old. They are also involved in farming. Susanna cultivates a 2.8 hectare plot of land, where she grows tomatoes, cucumbers and corn. She has been running the farm for 16 years. 

She has applied for this loan to start and complete the land cultivation this Spring. She wants to purchase corn and watermelon seeds. She will also use the loan amount to pay fees concerned with cultivating the land with agricultural techniques. Successful cultivation of the land will allow Susanna to gather a rich harvest to sell, and thereby increase her income from agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for corn and watermelon seeds and for cultivating the land.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda lives in Kator. She sells from a food stall, and has been in business for four years. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school. 

She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase maize flour and beans to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour and beans to sell.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel is patiently selling bananas and tomatoes to the people in their village. In this kind of business, she usually earn about P2,500 each month. Now, she would like to increase her sales, so she is asking for a loan of P4,000 to buy more vegetables to sell, such as cabbages, eggplant and string beans. Someday, Liezel would like to earn funds to use when emergency arises.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell, such as cabbages, eggplant and string beans.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita, a 36-year-old married woman living at Palayag, uncomplainingly generates an income from her vegetable vending business. This way, she provides daily allowances for her children. She has eight children and three are attending school. The rest have settled into marriage. 

She is now asking for a loan of P3,000 to buy cabbages, tomatoes, and eggplant to sell. She hopes this loan will be granted to her and promises to pay it on time.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes and eggplant to sell.

loans.name: Negociantes Group

texts.es:
Las Negociantes son un grupo solidario de la Colonia Topo Chico, al norte de Monterrey. Ellas están solicitando su segundo crédito con esta institución y en el primero se distinguieron por ser un grupo muy puntual. El grupo está compuesto por 7 mujeres emprendedoras que con este crédito esperan poder continuar superándose a si mismas y mejorando sus negocios. 

Idalia Guadalupe es una de las mujeres del grupo. Ella tiene 3 hijos entre 13 y 17 años. Los 3 están estudiando, uno en la secundaria y los otros 2 en la preparatoria. Como toda madre, ella desea la mejor educación posible para sus hijos. Por lo que, Idalia comenzó hace 3 años con su negocio de arreglos florales. Ella prepara estos arreglos para ocasiones especiales, como el día de las madres, el día de los muertos, el día del padre, así como bodas y fiestas de XV años. Con ayuda del crédito desea poder comprar más materiales como jarrones, listones y plásticos para poder realizar diferentes tipos de arreglos. Ella espera poder consolidar su micro negocio y algún día poder establecerse en un local.
texts.en:
Las Negociantes are a support group in the Topo Chico neighborhood, in northern  Monterrey. They are asking for their second loan with this institution. With the first one the distinguished themselves for being very punctual. The group is made up of 7 enterprising women who hope to be able to continue getting ahead and improving their businesses with this loan.

Idalia Guadalupe is one of the women in the group. She has 3 children between the ages of 13 and 17. All 3 of them are in school, one in junior high and the other 2 in high school. Like all mothers, she wants the best education possible for her children. That is why 3 years ago she began her flower arranging business. She makes the arrangements for special occasions, such as Mothers' Day, the Day of the Dead, Father's Day, and weddings and quinceaneras. With the help of the loan, she wants to be able to buy more materials such as vases, ribbons and plastic items to be able to make different types of arrangements. She hopes to be able to consolidate her micro business some day and open a locale.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as vases, ribbons and plastic items.

loans.name: Ameri

texts.es:
Ameri de 54 años es una señora dulce y afable. Es soltera y vive con su madre a quien cuida en una casa propia ubicada en el anexo de Purhuaracra, distrito de San Pedro de Cajas – Tarma. Ameri es una mujer que le agrada el trabajo del campo. Siembra verduras de todas las variedades como: habas, coliflor, papa, alfalfa, arvejas, etc. Hace 30 años atrás que se dedica a esta actividad obteniendo buenos ingresos, de esa manera mantiene su hogar y puede ofrecerle a su anciana madre mejores atenciones, ya que se encuentra un poco enferma. “prefiero sembrar coliflores, porque en 3 meses ya estoy cosechando”, comenta. Su inversión es mayor para las semillas, por ejemplo, en cada temporada de siembra compra 200 gramos de semillas de coliflor con 1700 soles, ya que el kilo cuesta 7000 soles. Pero afirma que vale la pena.
Ameri tiene mucha fuerza, pero los años pasan por eso quiere cuidarse. El trabajo del campo es muy cansado, por lo que contrata personal operario para agilizar las faenas. Éste sería su crédito número 5 que recibiría de MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Productores de Purhuaracra” y se siente contenta de tener compañeros responsables.
Con el dinero del préstamo podrá adquirir 250 gramos de semillas de coliflor. Lo restante será para pagar a los peones que contratará.
texts.en:
Ameri is 54 years old and is a sweet and kind woman. She is single and lives with her mother, whom she takes care of in the house she owns, located in the annex to Purhuaracra, district of San Pedro de Cajas – Tarma. Ameri is a woman who likes to work in the fields. She plants all types of vegetables such as: beans, cauliflower, potatoes, alfalfa, peas, etc. She has done this activity for 30 years, making good income. This is how she supports her home and can offer her elderly mother better care, since she is a little ill. “ I prefer to plant cauliflower, because I am already harvesting it after 3 months," she comments. Her investment is mostly for seeds. For example, every season, she plants 200 grams of cauliflower seeds with 1,700 soles, since a kilo costs 7000 soles. She affirms that it is worth it. 

Ameri has a lot of strength, but the years are going by and she wants to take care of herself.  Fieldwork is very tiring, so she hires workers to ease the labor. This would be her 5th loan with MFP. That is why she is giving her word to make the monthly payments on time. She belongs to the “Productores de Purhuaracra” communal bank and she is happy to have responsible co-members. With the money from the loan, she will be able to acquire 250 grams of cauliflower seeds. The rest will be to pay the laborers that she will hire.

loans.use: to buy 250 gr of cauliflower seeds  and hire laborers.

loans.name: Saidia

texts.en: Saidia, a 34-year-old married mother of three, all of whom are in school, lives in Kator where she has been selling charcoal for four years. Saida learned about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and is now requesting her second loan for 800 Sudanese pounds to purchase more charcoal. She will use the extra income arising from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: At  the age of 18, Abigail started to involve herself in a direct-sales business, offering cosmetics and perfumes to her neighborhood. Now requesting a loan of P4,000 to buy more cosmetics, perfumes, and lotions to sell, in the future Abigail hopes to increase the income earned from her small business and save funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, perfumes, and lotions to sell.

loans.name: 08.02.02 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Dụ is 76 years old. She is married and has three children. Dụ lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
 
Dụ has a retail business selling dry food. Dụ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Dụ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase maize, sweet potatoes and peanuts for resale. With her business profit, Dụ hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to travel for vacation within the country.

Dụ is the group leader of the 08.02.02- Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2010, Dụ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dụ has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Dụ from  Viet Nam

loans.use: to purchase maize, sweet potatoes and peanuts for resale.

loans.name: Padi 3 Group

texts.en:
Suniah has been selling vegetables and groceries in front of her house for ten years. Every day her goods are almost sold out because she has daily customers. Only a few times have her goods gotten rotten. 

Her husband is a driver for public transportation. From both businesses, she can send her children to school. 

Now she wants to take a second loan from VisionFund Indonesia to buy more groceries and vegetables such as carrots to sell. She hopes her business keeps running well and more customers come to her. 

In the future she wants to have her own house and help her children get university degrees and better jobs.

loans.use: to pay for more groceries and vegetables such as carrots to sell.

loans.name: Padi 5 Group

texts.en:
Suprihatin has been selling gado-gado (mixed vegetables served with peanut sauce) for 20 years. She sells gado-gado in front of her house. Besides gado-gado, she also sells tea and children's snacks. Most of her customers are children in her area, so her daily sales depend on what the children want to eat. 

From this business she has been able to send her four boys to school. And now only one is still in school, in seventh grade. 

She plans to use her part of loan from VisionFund Indonesia to add a variety things to offer in her store such as pop ice and tea, and also to buy more vegetables to sell more gado-gado.

She likes to do this business because she inherited this business from her parents. In the future, she hopes her customers will never tire of buying her gado-gado.

loans.use: to pay for pop ice, tea and vegetables to make gado-gado to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 35 years old and married to Catherine. They are blessed with five children between 2 and 11 years old. 

Paul owns a retail shop, a business he started two years ago. He earns a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

He has requested a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase sugar, cooking fat, exercise books, pens and pencils. The anticipated profit will help pay school fees for his children as well as repay his loan. 


He dreams of opening a big supermarket as well as educating his children and becoming a good leader. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking fat, exercise books, pens and  pencils.

loans.name: Adeola Sabine

texts.fr: Adeola Sabine est mariée,âgée de 32 ans, et mère de trois enfants. Elle vend des tissus en complément de son activité de couture. En vue d'attirer sa clientèle à travers ses prestations, elle a eu recours au financement de FINADEV; ce qui lui permettra de bien s'occuper de sa famille, surtout de la scolarité de ses trois enfant et de tirer profits de ses ventes.
texts.en: Adeola Sabine is 32 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is a seamstress, and also sells fabric. In order to attract customers, she has approached FINADEV. This will allow her to take care of her family, in particular her children's education, and to make profit from her sales.

loans.use: to buy 30 pieces of fabric and 40 ready-to-wear outfits.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca de 35 años es una madre soltera. Vive con su hijo Antony de 3 años. Su casa es propia y se ubica en el anexo de Purhuaracra, distrito de San Pedro de cajas – Tarma. Rebeca es una mujer agricultora. Con la fuerza y coraje que la caracteriza logró construir su casa y adquirir algunos bienes, ya que desde la adolescencia se dedica a esta actividad.
“Siembro de todo, zanahorias, espinacas, ajos, lechugas, habas, papas y alfalfa. Me va bien en las ventas”, comenta. Pero lo que más le gusta hacer es vender alfalfa, por su crecimiento más rápido y por la poca inversión. Una vez que cosecha la alfalfa lo empaqueta y lo vende en su mismo distrito, ya que los ganaderos de su zona requieren de estos pastos para alimentar a sus vacas, carneros, cuyes, conejos, etc.
En cada cosecha lleva de 40 a 60 paquetes de alfalfa y los vende a 6 soles cada uno. Para ello tiene 7 parcelas que solo producen alfalfa. Las semillas son baratas, cada kilo cuesta a 40 soles. De manera inteligente Rebeca supo administrar bien su negocio, así le dará una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeño hijo, pues menciona que él es su mayor inspiración. Éste sería su crédito número 4 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Productores de Purhuaracra”, del que se siente a gusto por tener socios responsables.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de semillas de alfalfa e insecticidas. Además pagará los servicios de los peones que contratará para esta actividad.
texts.en:
Rebeca, aged 35, is a single mother.  She lives with her 3-year-old son Antony.  Her home is her own, and is located in the annexed area of Purhuaracra in the district of San Pedro de Cajas – Tarma. 

Rebeca is a women who works in agriculture.  With the strength and courage that characterizes her, she has been able to build her home and acquire some goods, as she has worked in agriculture since she was a teenager.

"I grow everything: carrots, spinach, garlic, lettuce, lima beans, potatoes, and alfalfa.  Sales have been going well for me", she comments.  But what she likes most is selling alfalfa because of its speedy growth and the fact it requires little investment.  Once she harvests the alfalfa, she packs it up and sells it in her own district, as the livestock farmers in her area want alfalfa to feed their cows, rams, guinea-pigs, rabbits, etc.  She gets 40 to 60 packs of alfalfa from each harvest, and sells them at 6 soles each, which is why she has seven parcels of lands which only produce alfalfa.  The seeds are cheap; each kilo costs 40 soles.  Rebeca succeeds in running her business well and in an intelligent manner, which provides a better quality of life for her young son, who she mentions is her biggest inspiration.

This will be her fourth loan from MFP, so she agrees to be punctual in her monthly repayments.  She belongs to the “Los Productores de Purhuaracra” ["The Producers of Purhuaracra"] communal bank, which she enjoys for its responsible members.

She will invest the money in purchasing alfalfa seeds and insecticides.  She will also pay for the services of workers whom she will hire for her farming.

loans.use: to purchase alfalfa seeds and insecticides, and also to hire workers.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 44 years old and has been raising hogs to sell for over 10 years now. Adelaida is a  very strong and determined woman. Adelaida's physical appearance looks somewhat masculine because she has been a boyish type of girl ever since she was young. She is now married to a farmer. 

She is asking for additional capital to ensure her hogs' sustainability. She would like borrow PHP 4,000 to buy feed and vaccines for the hogs. She hopes to keep making her business profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for the hogs.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene in 27 years old and has two children attending school. 

She sells vegetables on a house-to-house basis. This way she can easily sell the vegetables. She had been doing it for five years now. 

She would like to borrow a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy more cabbages, tomatoes, eggplant and string beans to sell. 

She hopes to keep making her business gainful.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages, tomatoes, eggplant and string beans to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 49-year-old married woman with seven children. Three are still studying; the rest live with them. 

She is raising hogs to fatten and sell to butchers as her business. She usually earns PHP 3,000 whenever she sells an animal. 

She would like to buy another piglet to raise, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy a piglet and more feed. 

She hopes to continue raising hogs for the improvement of the overall living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy a piglet and more feed.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda de 52 años, es una madre soltera. Tiene 7 hijos pero solo vive con los menores de 20 y 24 años. Habita una casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Villa Visca, distrito de Huasahuasi – Tarma. La principal actividad económica a la que se dedica desde los 18 años, es la agricultura, sus cultivos constan de arveja, zanahorias, papa, habas  y otras verduras; los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos ubicados a las afueras de su localidad. “La cosecha de papa es grande, para llevar la producción contrato un camión que me cobra 2 soles y 50 céntimos por cada saco, y en cada carga se lleva 80 sacos”, comenta orgullosa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder pasar la mayor parte del tiempo en el campo, más le desagrada los problemas que tiene que afrontar cuando las plagas azotan sus cultivos. Por ese motivo también se dedica a la ganadería con el cuidado de animales menores como carneros, cuyes y vacas. Con los cuales obtiene una ganancia extra que le sirve para poder solventar cualquier inconveniente en la agricultura. 
Sus ventas mayormente las realiza en su distrito, y lo sobrante (20 sacos) en Tarma por kilos. Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser una mujer puntual. Acaba de ingresar al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y avizora que el trabajo será productivo por la responsabilidad de los socios.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos y una bolsa de semillas de arvejas que cuesta a 600 soles.
texts.en:
Yolanda, aged 52, is a single mother.  She has seven children, but lives only with the youngest ones who are aged 20 and 24.  She lives in her own home, located in the village of Villa Visca, in the district of Huasahuasi – Tarma.

The main money-earning activity that she has been working in for the last 18 years is farming.  Her crops consist of peas, carrots, potatoes, lima beans, and other vegetables, which she grows in her own fields located on the outskirts of her village.  "The potato harvest is large, in order to collect the production, I hire a truck which earns me 2 soles and 50 centimes for each sack, and each load takes 80 sacks", she comments proudly.

What she most likes about her work is being able to spend the greater part of her time in the fields.  What she dis likes most are the problems she has to face when the pests infest her crops.  For this reason, she also works with livestock, taking care of small animals such as rams, guinea-pigs and cows.  With these she earns some extra money which she uses to be able to cover anything that comes up with her farming.

She makes most of her sales in her district, and sells the remainder (20 sacks) in Tarma by the kilo.  

This will be her first loan with MFP, so she gives her word to be a punctual woman.  She has just joined the "Villa Visca" communal bank, and envisions that her work will be productive because of the responsibility of the members.

She will invest the money in purchasing bags of organic fertilizer, and a bag of pea seeds which will cost 600 soles.

loans.use: to purchase bags of manure and pea seeds.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora lives in Kator. She sells fish and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Flora heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden lives in Kator. She sells loaves of bread and has been in business for two years. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Kiden heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase bread. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase bread for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 34 years old, comes from Nakuru, and is a mother to three children who are still in school.

Margaret has a food kiosk business that she has been running for the past 12 years and she has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD, to enable her to buy more maize, beans and firewood for her business.

She hopes to grow her business and in future to diversify into a retail business.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans and firewood

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 19 years old and single. She temporarily stopped her education due to financial reasons. She is now selling fish balls and hotdogs to acquire an income. Catherine patiently involves herself in this business so that she can continue her studies someday. 

She is now borrowing a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fish balls, hotdogs and squid balls to sell. This will help boost her profits.

Someday, she will be very happy and proud if she finishes her studies.

loans.use: to buy fish balls, hotdogs and squid balls to sell.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, photographed next to their house.

Aziza is a 48-year-old woman, a mother with four sons and three daughters. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's expenses and needs.

Aziza is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing construction bricks  and installing new doors and windows to complete their house and improve its condition. This will offer Aziza and her family suitable living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase construction bricks, doors and windows to complete their house

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel lives at Palayag with her child. Her spouse works abroad. 

Running a small store occupies her daily schedule. She sells grocery items to the people in her village. She is happy to meet the demands of customers who might need a sachet of shampoo or some other daily item. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more soap, shampoo, canned goods, milk and sugar to sell. She hopes to expand her business and grow as a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy more soap, shampoo, canned goods, milk and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Bright

texts.en:
Bright is a determined young man of 25 who has been running his money transfer business since July 2011. He wants to use his loan money to purchase a small computer to speed up his transactions and to employ two people in his shop so that he can serve his customers faster. He also wishes to use the money to increase his working capital. 

Access to financial services in Zambia is both scarce and expensive. Close to 10 million Zambians, 80% of the population, do not have bank accounts. As most Zambians live in rural areas, distance and transportation factors hinder access to available financial services. Mobile Transactions Zambia Limited (MTZL) is an early stage company that specializes in low-cost mobile money and other financial transaction services by propagating an open network using small businesses called champion agents. Bright is one of the champion agents. This is his story. 

When Bright first started his business his main focus was to get people in his community to know about the service that he provides. He started off by doing direct sales to customers in his community by distributing flyers and explaining his business to them in person. His strategy paid off because barely a month later his transactions had increased from a mere 10 transactions a day to 48 transactions a day. Because of the quick growth of his business he faces the challenge of working float (electronic and cash value of his working capital) which means he does not have enough working capital to satisfy his customers from time to time. He frequently has to close his shop and make trips to the bank to convert his electronic money to cash and vice versa.

Bright is currently living with his grandmother, who is taking care of five other people. He continues to work extra hard so that he can be able to move out of his grandmother's house and get his own place. In the next five years, Bright sees himself as a full blown businessman. He plans to open money transfer shops in two new locations. 

In Bright's video, the interview is conducted by a representative of Mobile Transactions.

loans.use: To purchase a small computer to speed up his transactions, to hire more people and to increase his working capital.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa lives in Kator. She sells fish and has been in business for four years. She is 35 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Teresa heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 39 years old and single. He sells milk and has been in business for the past seven years. He gets a monthly income of 7,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from his business. 

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. He was introduced to KADET by a customer. He will use the loan to purchase more milk for sale in his business. 

He hopes to open a milk bar in his home area.

loans.use: to buy more milk for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bales of children's clothes and ladies' blouses and skirts for sale.

loans.name: Styopa

texts.en:
Styopa is a 26-year-old farmer from Meghry. Besides agriculture he also is a contract military man at the local military unit. Styopa has been involved in cattle breeding for three years, and through this period he has expanded the farm and created favorable conditions for its further development. 

Styopa has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle he is raising. With the requested amount he plans to purchase two cows and forage to feed the cattle. Expansion of the farm means increased income from agriculture, which is vital for him to create better living conditions for his family in the future. Styopa lives with his wife.

loans.use: to pay for cows and forage

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine lives in Kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for one year. She is 23 years old, married, and has no children. 

Katherine heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 63 years old. She lives in Yerevan with her husband, daughter and two little grandchildren. Karine is involved in the retail business. She trades in women's clothing and shoes. Karine's husband helps her to run the business. Karine's two grandchildren both attend school. 

Karine has applied for this loan to increase the variety of clothing she sells. With the requested amount she plans to purchase women's clothing. This loan will help Karine to increase sales and income, which is important for her to to cover the family's daily costs and insure a better quality of life for them.

loans.use: to pay for clothing

loans.name: Fatna

texts.en:
Fatna lives in Kator. She sells charcoal and has been in business for four years. She is 25 years old, married, and has two children; both of them are still in school. 

Fatna heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kator. She sells fish, and has been in business for two years. She is 25 years old, married, and has two children; all of them are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a simple woman but full of hopes in life. She is 25 years of age, married to Clifford, and blessed with only one child.

Jenny is glad because it's been five years of sacrifices she has devoted to her community based-store. Over that period of time, she has been able to sustain her family needs. But as days pass, the price of basic commodities is increasing and the feed and vaccines for her hogs are also expensive.

In this situation, Jenny really suffers from shortage of capital. So, she is asking for financial support in the amount of P10,000, allowing her to buy more merchandise for her retail store.This loan would really help her in increasing sales and profit which will serve to her family.

Jenny would be thankful if her requested loan is granted because she could minimize her fare expenses and effort in going to and from the market. She believes that her sacrifices will have a fruitful outcome in obtaining success in life and business.

loans.use: to be used in buying more merchandise for her retail store

loans.name: Ragheda

texts.en:
Ragheda is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, photographed in their house. 

Ragheda is a 38-year-old woman, she is a mother with one son and four daughters, her husband is employed and gets a salary which is not enough to cover the family's costs. 

Ragheda is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing cement and bricks to complete building the family's house. This will help Ragheda and her family to complete the house and move in to it soon to enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase cement and bricks to complete building her house

loans.name: Nay

texts.en:
Nay is a 42-year-old married woman living with her husband and four children in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. The family's main business activity is rice farming, and she is very diligent in her daily work to produce a good harvest.

Nay is now requesting her fourth loan from HKL to purchase cows. In the coming years, she intends to expand her business and save money for future family emergencies that may arise.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.en:
Vazgen is a 22-year-old young entrepreneur and student from Yerevan. He runs a shop where he raises fish in aquariums and sells them. Vazgen has been successfully running the business for five years, and now he wants to enlarge it. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase fish and necessary food for them.
 
Vazgen lives with his parents. With the development of the business, Vazgen will receive more income and help to cover the family's costs and pay his educational fees.

loans.use: to pay for fish and food

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth, a 37-year-old married mother of four children  aged 13, 10, 7 and 5 years, owns a grocery store that she started two years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 2,000 and is requesting a loan of KES 5,000 to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. Ruth will reinvest the profits in her business and hopes to become a successful business woman and purchase a lorry.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
Nazario de 33 años, vive en compañía de su madre,  a la que cuida con mucha cariño por su avanzada edad.  Ambos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Villa Visca, distrito de Huasahuasi – Tarma. Desde hace más de 15 años, Nazario se dedica a sembrar papas y arvejas, en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, “en temporadas de siembra grande alquilo terrenos, así aseguro una buena cosecha”, dice. Le gusta el trabajo del campo porque se relaja cada vez visita sus parcelas. Las faenas son cansadas y absorben todo el tiempo de Nazario, por eso contrata personal operario para apresurar las actividades. 
Cuando termina de atender sus cultivos, trabaja como peón en diferentes sembríos. Le pagan 25 soles por día. Así gana un dinero extra. 
Ahora está trabajando en una empresa constructora de su distrito. Su sueldo es fijo, por eso no se preocupa en el pago de sus deudas.
Su principal preocupación es la falta de más terrenos agrícolas, ya que alquilando gasta más dinero, por ello está ahorrando lo necesario para poder comprar una y aumentar su producción. Éste sería su crédito número 11 que recibiría, gracias a su ayuda, de MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, se siente bien trabajando con personas solidarias y perseverantes. Nazario podrá comprar 4 bolsas de semillas de arvejas con 2400 soles en promedio; lo restante lo destinará para la compra de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Nazario is 33 years old, and he lives with his mother.  He takes care of her with great affection because she is elderly.  They live together in their own house in the Villa Visca settlement in the Huasahuasi – Tarma district.

For over 15 years Nazario has been growing potatoes and peas on his own agricultural land.  “During the planting seasons I rent land, and that way I am assured of a good harvest,” he says.  He likes working in the field because it relaxes him every time he visits his fields.  

Working on the land is tiring, and it absorbs all of Nazario’s time.  That is why he hires day workers to accelerate the work.  When he is done tending to his crops he works as a day worker on different fields.  They pay him 25 soles a day, and that is how he earns extra money.  

He is now working for a construction company in his district.  His salary is fixed so he does not worry about paying his debts.  His main worry is the lack of more agricultural land.  Renting uses up more money.  Therefore, he is saving what he needs in order to be able to buy more land and increase his production.

This will be his 11th loan, thanks to the help from MFP.  He pledges to be punctual with his monthly payments.  He belongs to the Villa Visca communal bank.  He feels good working with supportive and perseverant people.  Nazario will be able to buy four bags of pea seeds for an average of 2,400 soles.  He will use the rest of the loan to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy bags of pea seeds and bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Herbert is 64 years old, married to Jane, and blessed with three children aged 24, 12 and 6 years. He has been farming for 20 years and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. Now requesting his third loan for KES 100,000 to purchase fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the planting season, Herbert will use the profits to improve his farm.  He hopes to lead a good life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds in preparation for the planting season.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Jonatán, su hijo al que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chalampampa. Hace poco adquirió su propia casa, en una zona céntrica de la ciudad. Se siente desarrollada por eso, comenta que su principal ingreso económico es la venta de leche. Tiene una estancia en la localidad de Pusqui, donde cuida de sus 3 vacas lecheras de buena calidad, al día le brindan de 15 a 20 litros de leche, los cuales vende después de cada ordeño a la fábrica de yogurt más reconocida de su localidad. Por ello al culminar el día regresa con un ingreso propio. Pero en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de fruta en una de las calles céntricas de Pampas, donde obtiene también un ingreso extra. Ahora desea comprarse una moto, con lo que podrá desplazarse de su pueblo a la ciudad, su nueva casa, con más facilidad, pues es la movilidad es muy cara y pierde mucho tiempo en esperar. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida. Además le gusta pertenecer a su asociación, porque sus integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Julia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de calaminas para techar su casa nueva.
texts.en:
Julia, age 35, is a hard-working woman.  She lives with her son, Jonatán.  She takes care of him in her own house in Chalampampa.  She got her own house, which is in a central area of the city, a little while ago.  She feels empowered by this.

She says that her main financial income is from selling milk.  She has a farm in Pusqui, and that is where she takes care of her three good quality milk cows.  They produce between 15 and 20 liters of milk a day.  Each time she is done milking the cows she sells the milk to a well-known yogurt factory in her area.  Therefore, when she finishes the day she returns with her own income.  

During her free time she sells fruit on one of the central streets of Pampas.  That is where she gets extra income.  Now she wishes to buy a motorcycle with which she would be able to travel more easily from her town to the city and to her new house. Transportation is very expensive, and she wastes a lot of time waiting.

This is her fifth loan with MFP.  She is happy because she has the money she needs to improve her business, which will improve her quality of life.  She likes belonging to her communal bank because the members are supportive and hard-working people.  Julia will use the requested loan to buy corrugated sheeting to put a roof on her new house.

loans.use: to buy corrugated sheeting to put a roof on her new house.

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en:
Sieng, 47, is married and lives in a peaceful village in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She owns a store and sells merchandise including groceries such as canned foods, snacks, biscuits, soft drinks and other types of household products out of her house. From this business, she is able to earn USD 2.00 per day to support her family, while another main source of income is from her spouse who runs a pig fattening project and distils Khmer traditional white wine.

Sieng is requesting credit to purchase 16 piglets and 10 sacks of feed to make a stable business for the family.  This will be her third loan from HKL. She has paid off the previous two loans already. In the future,  Sieng wants to have a medium-sized farm for raising and breeding pigs.

loans.use: to purchase 16 piglets and 10 sacks of feed to make a stable business for the family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy leather, cloth and embroidery material for glove-making business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 46 years old, married to Alice, and blessed with two children. He operates a hardware shop in Nyahururu town. He plans to use this loan amount to buy more stock of hardware items like nails, paint, iron sheets and pipes for sale. 

In the future, Peter hopes to expand his business and open other hardware shops in Nyahururu.

loans.use: To buy more stock  of nails, paint, iron sheets and pipes for sale.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her dairy business. With the loan investment, she will buy another buffalo that will help increase milk quantity, and her profits. She is very active and provides good quality milk to her clients, due to which she has a good reputation, and her clientele is growing. She is confident that she will be able to fulfill the increasing needs of her clients by purchasing another buffalo. 

Her husband is a driver and provides transport services to passengers. Nasreen is the mother of six children. Three of them are studying, while the others remain at home. Nasreen is very happy and confident about her business success after investing the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for her dairy business

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech is 51 years old and is responsible for five children, four of whom are employed in various jobs in Phnom Penh city. Each month they always share part of their incomes to help the family. Pech’s main business activities focus on agriculture, including crops and livestock husbandry. Most work at the rice field is managed as well by him. Therefore, Pech can take time to raise livestock at home. 

Due to the lack a family-owned family, Pech’s family is experiencing difficulties in living. To deal with the problem, Pech now would like to have these funds to purchase a motorcycle for home use. In future, Pech anticipates renovating his house because it’s a bit old and is in need of repair.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for home use.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 31 years old. He lives in Verishen village with his wife. Four years ago, Armen got involved in the agricultural business. Armen runs a farm, where he is raising three cows and five pigs. 

Armen has applied for this loan to develop pig breeding. With the requested loan he plans to purchase 16 pigs and barley and wheat to feed them. 

Development of pig breeding will allow Armen to  increase his income from agriculture, which is vital for him to insure a prosperous future for his family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for pigs, barley and wheat

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine doesn’t produce quality work and takes much time to sew a single dress. By purchasing a new sewing machine she will be able to finish the orders on time and it will help her make more profits. 

Her husband does a job for a low income which is not enough for the whole family. That’s why Rehana started her business a few years ago to support her husband financially. She has given birth to 2 daughters and a son. All of them are enrolled in local school and getting their education. Rehana also performs her household duties very well along with her business and her family is very happy with her efforts. 

She is confident about her business success as a result of a loan investment.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run is 31 years old, a married woman who has been residing in Ang Snoul district of Kandal province. She acts as a seamstress from her own house and provides sewing services to local people. From this business, she is able to generate an average income of 5 USD each day. She has a common law relationship with her spouse who works for a private company in Phnom Penh city. They are blessed with a child who is still attending school.

At the present, Run is asking for a loan of 500 USD from HKL to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband commuting to work daily. This loan will allow Run to solve the financial difficulties and upgrade her living condition.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband commuting to work daily.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 48 years old, widowed, and supports one person in her family. She sells new shoes and second-hand clothes, a business she ventured into eight years ago and she earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more new shoes and bales of jackets and trousers for sale. 

The profit she earns from this business will help her repay her loan. Her dream is to expand her business and move to a bigger shop, and this is her first loan.

loans.use: To buy more new shoes and bales of jackets and trousers for sale.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is 25 years old. He lives in Hatsavan village with his parents. The main source of income for the family is agriculture: cattle breeding and land cultivation. The family has been running the farm for nine years. 

Artak needs some financial investments to start and complete the land cultivation. With the requested amount he plans to purchase fertilizer and fuel for agricultural machines. He also plans to renovate the machines and organize  the land cultivation process more effectively. 

This loan will help Artak to maintain the growth of the farm and have a stable source of income, which is important for him to create  improved living conditions for his future family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, fuel and renovation of agricultural techniques.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
From Kompong Speu province, where Keo, 57, lives with her husband and three children, she cultivates the land for her livelihood. Rice is the main focus of the family. Keo has been engaged in the business for more than 30 years. She learned all the methods and followed the path of her ancestors in the way she lives and works.

She is taking out a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to buy construction supplies, which she will use to repair her present house. In the coming years, she wants to expand her farm and further establish the business.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Munaza's Group

texts.en:
Munaza has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. She is very skilful and has a lot of enthusiasm for her work. She can sew designer and non-designer dresses. She didn’t get any training in sewing but due to her interest and creativity she sews well and is praised by her customers. 

With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine has become old which is affecting on her work. 

By purchasing a new sewing machine she will be able to complete orders on time and increase her profits.  She is very experienced in her business and confident about her business success after investing the loan into it.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Pring

texts.en:
This family's main business is to cultivate rice, from which Pring can earn a suitable income annually to satisfy the family’s needs in a sufficient way. Pring is 48 years old and has been in the business for ages. Most of the time she works alongside her husband who is in the same type of business. Together, they have been blessed with 2 children, who live independently.

Pring would like to acquire a loan through HKL to purchase additional floorboards and columns to get the unfinished parts of the construction done. She hopes to have a comfortable house for living. She is thankful for the support and she commits to pay her loan back on time by the set schedule as it is now her second loan from our firm.

loans.use: to purchase additional floorboards and columns to get the unfinished parts of the construction done.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen is 52 years old. He lives in Verishen village with his 49-year-old wife and 80-year-old mother. Armen's children are married and live apart. The family is involved in cattle breeding. The main income comes from selling received milk and meat. Armen would like to increase his income by selling more milk and meat. To implement this goal, he plans to purchase two more cows. Armen will also use the loan amount to purchase grass to feed the cattle. With increased income, Armen will not only improve his household conditions, but also support his children's young families.

loans.use: to pay for cows and grass

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Huon resides with her husband and four single children in Baray district, Kompong Tom. Most of her children are students attending local public schools. Huon earns a living by cultivating rice both seasons of the year. She is now 31 years old and she has been in the business since 2008.

For additional income, Huon would like to ask for some funds from Kiva partner, HKL, to purchase piglets for fattening and a sow for breeding purposes. She hopes she will be able to make a good income from the investment.

loans.use: to purchase piglets for fattening and a sow for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah has been in the cereals business in Nakuru town for the last 12 years. She is a 35-year-old single lady.

Sarah was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers during a marketing awareness done in her area. This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more cereals like green grams (mung beans) and maize to sell in her business.

In the future, Sarah hopes to expand her business and supply cereals to other parts of Nakuru.

loans.use: To buy cereals like green grams and maize for resale

loans.name: Felton

texts.en:
Felton is a 46-year-old butchery owner in Mikindani, Mombasa. He is married and a father of five school-going children. His business has been in operation for the past 14 years. The business is doing great.

This marks his first business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to use the loan to renovate his butchery. 

He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and expand his business further. He hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business in the future.

loans.use: to renovate his butchery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crates of soda, bottles of mineral water, sweets, and biscuits for sale.

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica operates a small store in which she offers different kinds of basic commodities. She just started this business last year; previously, she had devoted her time to running her hog-raising business. Rica is a young entrepreneur and married woman. She lives with her whole family in the village of Rizaluna, Cordon. Her place is far from the market and relies more on agricultural business.

Since Rica has just started her small store, she would like to buy more groceries that are needed in her village. But due to insufficient funds, Rica is motivated to borrow additional capital from lenders in the amount of 10,000 Philippine pesos. She hopes to obtain the requested loan amount in order to increase her profits, which will serve her children's education and improve their living condition.

loans.use: to buy more groceries which are needed in her village

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Tayseer appears in her Kiva profile photo, with the picture next to his taxi.

Khitam is a 44-year-old woman, a mother with two daughters. For the past 10 years, Khitam's husband has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family.

Khitam is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing new engine for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable Khitam's husband to take additional requests for trips in and out of town,  which will improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for the taxi

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37 years old, married, and blessed with four children aged 13, 11, 7 and 5 years. She runs a grocery business that she started three years ago and earns a monthly income of 7,000 KES.

She wants to purchase more fruits, vegetables, raw maize, and beans for sale. Her profit will be reinvested in her business. This is her first loan, and she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, raw maize, and beans for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 28 years old and married. He and his wife Peninah have one child. He has operated an electronics shop in Naivasha for the last two years. He plans to use this loan to buy more stock of electronics for sale and thereby meet his clients’ needs and demands as well as be able to increase his income. 

In the future, Stephen hopes to invest more in his business and get more income so that he can buy a plot of land and build both residential and commercial houses.

loans.use: To buy more stock of electronic items for sale

loans.name: Mout

texts.en:
Mout is 40 years old. She lives in the Pouk district with her family: her husband and five single children. Mout has run an agriculture business since 2005. She farms rice and raises piglets for sale.

Now Mout would like to earn more income by developing her pig-breeding business. For this reason, she has applied for this loan to purchase pigs and feed. She is very excited about the loan and is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and forage to feed them.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 29 years old, and he and his wife Rhoda have three children. He operates a barbershop and has been in this business for the past two years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member. He will use the loan to purchase two chairs for use in his business and also purchase socks and caps for sale to his barbershop customers.

Maurice hopes to expand and open a salon to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy two chairs for use in his business and  socks and caps for sale to the men he shaves.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
So is 30 years old. She is from the Baray district in the Kompong Tom province. She is married and has a young child. She commonly works in agriculture, especially rice and pig husbandry.
