Kyalo is requesting a 25,000 KES loan—his first—from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more goods such as basins, jugs, buckets and plastic baskets to sell. With his profits he plans to pay back the loan and support his family. His ambition is to live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more products for the home to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, 43, is from Nakuru and married to Jesse. They have three children who are all in school.

For the past three years Mercy has managed a posho mill where she grinds maize into flour, then sells it to her customers. She is applying for her first loan—30,000 KES—from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more dried maize to grind and enable her to meet the demands of her clients.

Mercy’s ambition is to be able to produce and supply maize and maize flour to different institutions in the future.

loans.use: to buy more dried maize.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 51 years old. She lives in the village of Aygezard with her 54-year-old husband, their 29-year-old son and 24-year-old daughter-in-law.

For the past five years Susanna’s family has sustained themselves well through farming and breeding cattle. She is now requesting a loan of 2,500 USD from SEF to buy three cows. She feels the addition of the cows will improve the farm and increase the family’s income. In this way Susanna’s family will improve its living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for three cows.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 27 years of age and blessed with two children. For the past year she has sold secondhand clothes, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Mildred has requested a loan—her first—of 20,000 KES to buy bales of skirts, bedspreads and sheets. The profit she earns from this business would help her educate her children.

Mildred’s ambition is to be a success in her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of skirts, bedspreads and sheets.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is photographed next to his taxi.

Eyad is a 41-year-old man, and he is married with six sons and two daughters. For the past 4 years, Eyad has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project but not enough to cover all the family's costs.

Eyad is requesting a $3,000 US dollar (USD) loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of licensing and insuring his taxi. This will make the taxi legal and enable Eyad to work extra hours and take more internal and external requests. This will improve the family's income.

loans.use: To pay for licensing and insuring his taxi.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 32 years old from Nakuru. He and his wife Ann have two children who are in school.

Victor has a baking business that he runs from his house. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy an oven, which will boost his business. 

He hopes to open a bakery in the near future.

loans.use: To buy an oven.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila, de 43 años, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene seis hijos de 24, 23, 20, 18, 15 y 8 años, aun viven con ella aun que solo los cuatro menores dependen de ella para su alimentación y educación, ella tiene una casa propia donde vive junto a sus seis hijos y su pareja, trabaja mucho para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Lucila consiste en la venta de comida, sale por las tardes a la vereda de su casa donde con la ayuda de sus hijos coloca una mesa larga, la parrilla, el asador y las bancas, después atiza su carbón e inicia con la jornada de venta de los mas deliciosos y sabrosos platos como el juane, tacacho, etc., como es de buena sazón tiene muchos clientes que le son fieles por que siempre les da con una pequeña porción más. Lleva trabajando un año y medio y está contenta por que le está yendo bien y así puede generar ganancias en su hogar. Le gusta de su trabajo que por las mañana puede utilizar su tiempo para otras actividades que también son fundamentales para sus ingresos, tiene clientes todos los días ya que está ubicada en un lugar muy accesible para el publico y esto le permite incrementar sus ingresos a diario y brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, espera más adelante consolidar su restaurante que puso con el crédito anterior ya que está en proceso de expansión. Este será el crédito número 14 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete una vez mas de cumplir co el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal y pode formar al grupo para que todos sean personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará ingredientes, insumos y utensilios para continuar con su trabajo ya que desea implementar con mas cosas para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucila, age 43, is in a common-law marriage.  She and her life partner have six children, ages 24, 23, 20, 18, 15, and 8.  They still live with her even though only the four minors are dependent upon her for food and education.  She has her own house where she lives with her six children and her life partner.

She works a lot in order to give her family a better quality of life.  Lucila sells food.  In the afternoons she goes out to the sidewalk to her house where her children help her set up a large table, the grill, the roaster, and the benches.  Then she stokes the charcoal fire and starts with the work of selling the most delicious and flavorful dishes like “juanes” (a traditional chicken and rice meal) and “tacacho” (a Peruvian dish of fried plantain mashed with pork rind), etc.

Due to the good seasoning of her food she has a lot of loyal customers because she always gives them a little bit larger portion.  She has been working for a year and a half.  She is happy that it is going well for her, and she can therefore generate income for her household.  The thing she likes about her work is that in the morning she is able to use her time for other activities, which are also fundamental to her income.

She has customers every day because she is located in an area that is very accessible to the public.  This allows her to increase her daily income and to provide her family with better living conditions.  In the future she hopes to strengthen the restaurant that she set up with the previous loan.  It is in the process of expanding.

This will be her 14th loan with MFP.  She is hoping for your contribution in order to continue with her objectives.  She pledges once again to make her payments as she did with her previous loans.  She is very happy to belong to her communal bank and to be able to shape a group where all of the people are responsible and supportive.

She will use the requested 2,500 soles to buy ingredients, supplies, and utensils in order to continue her work.  She wishes to be set up with more things in order to give her customers better service.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, cooking supplies, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en:
Scolastica is 30 years old and blessed with two children. She runs a school that she started 7 years ago and earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES). 

Scolastica has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase additional desks and other teaching materials. She will invest the anticipated profit in school activities.

Her dream is to see her school prosper and to buy a large piece of land on which to build a modern school. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more desks and other teaching materials.

loans.name: Halim

texts.ru: Халим женат и на воспитании имеет шестерых детей. После распада союза он начал заниматься земледелием. Восемь лет тому назад он организовал свое дехканское хозяйство. В начале он имел хороший капитал, но большие затраты  на сельхозкультуры не оправдали расходы несколько лет подряд, в этой ситуации его выручил трактор, принадлежащий дехканскому хозяйству. На данный момент ему нужны дополнительные финансовые ресурсы для увлечения площади посева сельхозкультур. Халим запрашивает займ для покупки горюче-смазочных материалов и селитры. А также остальную сумму хочет использовать для найма дополнительной  рабочей силы.
texts.en: Halim is married and raising six children.  After the breakup of the Soviet Union, he became involved in farming.  He organized his own dekhan farm eight years ago.  He had a good capital at first, but large expenses for agricultural crops did not justify the expenses several years in a row, and a tractor, belonging to a dekhan farm, saved him in this situation.  At the present time, Halim needs financial resources to increase the area for sowing agricultural crops.  Halim is requesting this loan to buy fuel and lubricants and saltpeter.  He also wants to use the rest of the money to hire additional labor.

loans.use: to purchase saltpeter, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and daughter.

She and her husband have been involved in farming for ten years. Karine wants to expand her orchard and grow more trees. With the requested loan proceeds, she plans to purchase apricot and peach saplings. Karine expects to grow more crops through their harvests after a few years, which will allow her to increase her income and ensure a stable future for her family.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing peach and apricot saplings

location.town: Nor Ughi village of Ararat region

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 57 years old. She lives with her husband.

She and her husband run a farm, where they grow various types of fruit trees and vegetables. Mariam has applied for this loan to expand her orchard. Specifically, she plans to purchase apricot and peach saplings. This loan is important for Mariam to maintain her farm's crop output and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing apricot and peach saplings

location.town: Nor Ughi village of Ararat region

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Музаффар женат и на воспитании имеет пятерых детей. Более 10 лет он занимается купле- продажей скота. С детства имеет опыт  ухаживания за  скотом. Его семья очень трудолюбивая и они все дружно работают. Он впервые запрашивает займ, надеясь на то чтобы увеличить поголовье скота и расширить бизнес. После семейных мероприятий (свадьба) они продали несколько голов скота, и его бизнес пошел на упад. Это может сказаться на снижении жизненного уровня. Этот бизнес единственный, который приносит им доходы на содержание семьи. Музаффар запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью восстановления количества проданного скота. Он очень надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Muzaffar is married and raising five children.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over ten years.  He gained the experience of caring for livestock since childhood.  His family is very hardworking, and they all work together well.  Muzaffar is requesting a loan for the first time, hoping to increase his livestock headcount and expand the business.  They sold several heads of livestock after family events (a wedding), and his business began to decline.  This may get reflected in lowering the level of living.  This is the only business that yields an income to support the family.  Muzaffar is requesting this loan to buy livestock in order to compensate for the sold livestock.  He relies on your help and mercy very much.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Valida

texts.en:
Valida is a 52-year-old married woman. She and her husband have four children.

To earn a living, she is a market vendor and farmer. She sells different kinds of foods and drinks, including rice, macaroni, sugar, beverages, and seasonal fruits and vegetables. Difficult living conditions and a low pension pushed her to start her business many years ago. She explains that she has 12 years of experience in selling food and is a very experienced vendor. Products she sells are very popular, and her customers use these products in their daily lives. Valida's monthly income is approximately 320 AZN. Her husband helps her purchase new inventory.

She applied for a loan in the amount of 1,800 AZN to purchase more food products for her shop, which would allow her to increase her monthly turnover. She has loyal customers and already successfully repaid two prior loans.

loans.use: purchase more food products

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz is 59 years old, married, and has five children. She is a market vendor who sells different kind of goods such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, and candies. She has ten years of experience and has deep knowledge of the market and the demand of her clients. Her pension is not enough to cover basic needs, so she decided to start her own business. 

The food products she sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling foods is 250 AZN. Her husband helps to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is important financial income for her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of her good location, in the central bazaar of her  home city.

She applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more food products and to diversify her offerings in order to meet her customers` demand.

loans.use: to buy more food products

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали женат и на воспитании имеет одного сына. Его зовут Санчар и ему 2 года. Жена занимается домохозяйством и присматривает за ребенком. Шерали очень способный человек. Более 6 лет он занимается купле- продажей мужской одежды. Начинал он с уличной торговли, постепенно увеличил свой капитал. Взял займ в «ИМОН Интернешнл» и успешно работал и взял магазин в аренду. Он имеет много постоянных клиентов. Шерали планирует в будущем с помощью родных и получив займ в «ИМОН Инернешнл» открыть свой собственный магазин. Шерали хотел бы получить займ в размере 13000 Сомони для покупки новой одежды для пополнения оборотного капитала.м
texts.en: Sherali is married and raising one son.  His name is Sanchar, and he is two years old.  Sherali's wife is involved in household work and looks after the child.  Sherali is a very talented person.  He has been involved in buying and selling men's clothing for over six years.  He started with street sales and gradually increased his capital.  He obtained a loan from "IMON International", worked successfully and leased a store.  He has many regular customers.  Sherali  plans to open his own store in the future with the help of relatives and a loan from "IMON International."  Sherali wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 13,000 Somoni to buy new clothing in order to refill his working capital.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing

loans.name: Safura

texts.en:
Safura is a 45-year-old, single woman.

To earn a living, she breeds cows and cattle, and she sells milk and milk products, as well as cattle meat to local butchers. Safura has more than six years of experience in this field, thanks to her father who taught her the best ways to look after cattle.

Safura usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months, and then re-sells them for profits at the local livestock bazaar. She sells milk and yogurt to her neighbors. Her milk and meat sales generate approximately 350 AZN of income per month. Milk and yogurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan: people use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma, and they always use yogurt at meals; and milk products are considered very healthy and as a result are present in everyday life.

Safura applied for a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN to purchase one milk cow and animal feed. This would be her fourth loan from AqroInvest, and Safura explains that she has a good record of repaying her loans.

loans.use: to buy one milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
El señor Buenaventura, tiene 40 años de edad, es acompañado y tiene un hijo. Desde hace un año se dedica a realizar viajes a particulares en un pick-up, ya que es el único vehiculo que puede acceder al lugar, los autobuses pasan muy lejos de ese lugar.

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para completar el dinero para comprar el vehiculo que posee, ya que el que tenia estaba muy viejo y en malas condiciones. Con la inversión ayudara a las personas que necesitan de su servicio para salir al pueblo más cercano sin tener que caminar los quince kilómetros que hay de distancia.

De esta manera él obtendrá mejores ingresos, ya que podrá ir más lejos de donde llegaba con el vehiculo anterior y con los ingresos que reciba tendrá una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.

Don Buenaventura, desea cancelar el préstamo lo antes posible y solicitar otro para comprar un vehiculo más pesado para continuar mejorando su vida y la de su familia y posteriormente no tener que depender de los créditos sino solo de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Buenaventura, 40, has a spouse and a son.  For the last year he’s been providing trips for individuals in his pick-up truck because it’s the only vehicle able to access the place; buses pass by at a very far distance.

He’s asking Fundación Campo for a loan to complete the amount of money he needs to buy the truck he has because the one he used to have was very old and in poor condition.  With this investment he will help people who need his service in order to go to the nearest town without having to walk the 15 kilometer distance between them.

In this way, he will earn higher income because he’ll be able to travel farther than he was able to with his previous vehicle and with the income he earns will have a better quality of life for his family.

Buenaventura wants to pay off the loan as soon as possible and request another one to buy a heavier vehicle and continue improving his and his family’s life and eventually not have to depend on loans but only on his work.

loans.use: to complete the amount he needs to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en:
Sadiq is a 27-year-old, single man.

To earn a living, he sells fruits such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates, and bananas. With the help of AqroInvest CU, Sadiq was able to start his own business when he was unemployed and experiencing difficult living conditions. He has one year of experience in this field.

He explains that fruits are very popular among Azerbaijan people and in high demand during this time of year. People like to eat fresh fruits, and fruits are one of the main dessert options for guests. His shop is located in the center bazaar, so people constantly pass by his shop and stop to buy fresh fruit. His monthly income from this business is approximately 250 AZN. Sadiq's father helps sell the fruit.

Sadiq now wants to expand his business. The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover the high demand. As a result, he would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his turnover, which would in turn improve his family's living conditions. For this purpose he applied for a loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN. This would be his second loan, and he explains that he has a good record of repaying loans.

loans.use: to increase his stock by purchasing additional fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Madunawoe

texts.fr:
Madunawoe est une femme âgé(e) de 49 ans. Madunawoe travaille comme revendeuse de Dégué(nourriture faite avec le lait et du mil  ou du couscous) depuis 2007. Elle vend à la devanture de la maison avec 02 personnes.
Madunawoe a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de fabrication de Dégué( lait, sucre, couscous, mil). Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Madunawoe voudrait accroitre son activité en installant d’autres points de vente afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Madunawoe is 49 years old. Madunawoe has been selling Dégué (a food made of milk, millet and couscous) since 2007. She sells the Dégué in front of her house with two other people.
Madunawoe has requested her third loan with WAGES to purchase the ingredients to make Dégué (milk, sugar, millet, couscous). She would like to reinvest in the busiess.
In the next couple of years, Madunawoe would like to expand the business with other selling outlets in order to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients to make Dégué.

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es:
Gerson, de 29 años, es un hombre bueno, creativo y amble, es conviviente con Rubí de 30 años, y con quien tiene cuatro hijos, Xiomara de 11, Inda de 4, Joel de 4 y Jeremy de 1 mes de nacido, vive en casa de sus padres en donde le habilitaron un espacio y pudo construir un pequeño espacio en donde tiene a su familia. Gerson, tiene como trabajo la carpintería, es un hombre prodigioso con sus manos, pues puede convertir cualquier pedazo de madera en una obra de arte, además de hacer casas muy hermosas y elegantes, además de tener éste trabajo también los complementa con la venta de bebida ya que en su casa vende gaseosas y refrescos. En sus tiempos libre se va a la iglesia en donde apoya al sacerdote con algunas actividades. Lleva realizando su trabajo por más de cuatro años y aprendió de un maestro muy bueno que le dio las pautas exactas para hacer un excelente trabajo. Le gusta lo que hace pues expresa sus sentimientos y desea en cada obra o edificación que realiza, además tiene ingresos buenos que le permiten brindar tranquilidad en cuanto a la alimentación y educación para su familia, desea seguir trabajando para mas adelante poner un taller implementado en su casa. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además se compromete una vez mas a apagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y muy responsable como en créditos anteriores que tuvo, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará materiales y herramientas para seguir haciendo su trabajo, además implementara su stock con algunas bebidas ya que no desea quedarse sin productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gerson, 29, is a good, creative, kind man.  He lives with Rubí, 30, with whom he has four children: Xiomara, 11, Inda, 4, Joel, 4 and Jeremy, 1 month.  He lives in his parents’ house in an area they set aside for him to build a small space for his family.

Gerson’s work is carpentry.  He is very skilled with his hands because he can convert any piece of wood into a work of art as well as make very beautiful and elegant houses.  Besides this work, he also sells beverages and soft-drinks at home.  In his free time he goes to church where he helps out the priest with some activities.

He’s been doing his work for more than four years having learned from a very good teacher who gave him the exact guidance to make excellent work.  He likes what he does because he can express his feelings and hopes in each piece of work or building that he makes.  He also earns good income that gives him peace of mind with respect to food and education for his family.  He wants to continue working so that later on he can install a well-equipped workshop at home.

This will be loan #3 with MFP and he hopes this small loan will help him reach his goals.  He commits once more to make his installment payments in a punctual and very responsible way like he’s done with previous loans he’s gotten.  He is very happy to belong to his communal bank because all the members are very good and supportive.

He will use the requested 1200 soles to buy supplies and tools to continue doing his work.  He will also replenish stock with beverages because he doesn’t want to run out of product to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy carpentry tools as well as beverages to stock his business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 35 años, es una mujer luchadora, amable y emprendedora, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 18 y 16 años, quienes dependen de ella aun para su educación y alimentación, tiene una casa propia en donde comparte los días a lado de sus hijos, ella trabaja mucho pues desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Martha tiene un trabajo que consiste en la venta de comida en diferentes lugares, ella se levanta temprano para empezar la faena diaria, cocina y lleva sus deliciosos potajes a los diferentes aserraderos de la ciudad, donde tiene clientes que se ha sabido ganar gracias a la calidad de comida que da, tiene muy buena sazón y eso hace que sus clientes le sean fieles. Lleva trabajando por cuatro años en esta actividad y se va sola ya que sus hijos tienen que estudiar. Le gusta hacer su trabajo por que siempre le gustó la cocina, desde muy niña le encanto cocinar y que mejor que ganar dinero haciendo algo que le encanta, además que siente es muy gratificante ver la cara de agrado que ponen sus comensales al momento de degustar sus platos, espera mas adelante consolidar su trabajo y así seguir creciendo con lo que hace. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración par continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado ella se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual y cumplida como en los créditos anteriores que tuvo, además desea seguir trabajando con los socios de su banco comunal ya que todos son muy amables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará insumos e ingredientes para continuar haciendo sus deliciosos platos, además de verduras y diversas carnes para poder ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martha, 35, is a tenacious, kind, enterprising woman.  She’s a single mother of two children who are 18 and 16 years old and still depend on her for their education and food.  She has a house of her own where she shares her days with her children.  She works hard because she wants to provide a better quality of life for them.  

Martha’s work consists in food sales in various places.  She rises early to start her daily chores.  She cooks and takes her delicious meals to various sawmills in the city where she has customers that she’s won over thanks to the quality of her dishes; they are very tasty and that turns her customers into regulars.  She’s been working in this activity for four years and she does it alone because her children have to study.  She likes to do her work because she’s always liked cooking; ever since she was a little girl she loved to cook and how much better to earn a living doing something you love.  Besides, it is very gratifying to see the satisfied expressions on the faces of her diners at the moment of enjoying her dishes.  She hopes later on to consolidate her work to continue growing with what she does.

This will be loan #5 with MFP so she’s hoping for your collaboration so that she can continue toward her objectives.  On the other hand, she commits to continue being a punctual and responsible client like she was with past loans she got.  Besides, she wants to continue working with her communal bank's fellow members because they are all very kind and supportive.

She will use the requested 2000 soles to buy supplies and ingredients to continue preparing her delicious dishes as well as vegetables and various meats to offer a wider variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients as well as vegetables and meats.

loans.name: Prado Group

texts.en:
Steven, who is in his late 20s, is single. He has been running a business selling fresh fish for two years. He works from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy more fish and cover household expenses. He has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a loan to increase his stock of fish. His dream is to one day be able to open another fish shop.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Prado" which has a total of 18 members. Each will hold the others accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish for resale.

loans.name: Duo Ruth De Villa Nueva Group

texts.es: Duo Ruth de Villa Nueva.Maria Tiene 47 años de edad es unida tiene 4 hijos,ella tiene 7 años de dedicarse a la venta de animales,venta de ropa calzado y cosmeticos.nos comenta que esta luchando para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y agrandar mas su negocio ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa, calzado,cosmeticos y la compra de animales para la venta,espera que le puedan dar ese apoyo que ella nececita para salir adelante con su familia y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Duo Ruth de Villa Nueva: 

Maria is forty-seven years old and she has a partner and four children. She has spent seven years selling animals, clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. She tells us that she is fighting to give her children a better future and to grow her business. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and animals to sell. She hopes that this will give her the support she needs to move forward with her family and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and animals to sell.

loans.name: Parvin

texts.ru: Парвин трудолюбивый и добрый семьянин. С детства он мечтал стать водителем. Шесть лет тому назад его брат купил ему  автомашину марки «Москвич». На этой автомашине он начал перевозить пассажиров и таким образом зарабатывал деньги. Спустя 2 года он сам купил себе автомашину марки «Жигули» и продолжал свой бизнес. На сегодняшний день он хотел бы купить себе новую автомашину марки «Опель» для того чтобы комфортно и удобно было клиентам. С этой целью Парвин запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Parvin is a hardworking and honest family man. He always wanted to be a driver since he was young. Six years ago his brother bought him a car by the make "Moskvich." He started transporting passengers on this car and was making money this way. Two years later Parvin has bought himself a car by the make of "Jiguli" and continued his business. Today he wants to buy a new car by the make of "Opel" to make it more comfortable for his customers. With this goal Parvin is asking for a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni. He is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new car.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros, de 41 años, es una mujer valiente, luchadora y muy responsable, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 23, 21, 19 y 15 años quienes aun viven con ella en su casa propia que pudo comprarse con bastante esfuerzo y sacrificio, solo el mayor de sus hijos es independiente y le ayuda en algunos gastos del hogar y ella como madre soltera lleva la responsabilidad de trabajar para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos menores. Milagros tiene un trabajo que consiste en la venta ambulatoria de bolsas, ella se levanta temprano y se va a los mercados a ofrecer bolsas para el despacho de productos, trabaja entre los mercados mas cercas de su casa los mas transitados de la ciudad, en donde tiene un buen mercado de clientes, es muy querida ya que es carismática y sabe llegar a sus clientes. Tiene ocho años en éste trabajo que realiza sola ya que sus hijos aun estudian le apoyan durante algunas horas nada mas.
Le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo libre y que es independientes, ella sabe que de su trabajo depende el poder llevar buenos ingresos a su hogar es por eso que no se queja ni mucho menos se siente mal haciéndolo, tiene muchos clientes que gano durante el tiempo trabajando con esta actividad y vende mucho lo que le permite tener buenas ganancias, espera seguir creciendo con lo que hace ya que le permitirá mejorar la condición de vida de su familia, además quisiera tener un local para vender de manera mas formal. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas y así no quedar mal con el grupo al que pertenece ya que todos son muy responsables y muy buenos. Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará mas productos de plástico para continuar vendiendo a sus clientes quienes le solicitan de mayor tamaño y de diferente calidad.
texts.en:
Milagros, 41, is a brave, tenacious, very responsible woman.  She’s a single mother of four children who are 23, 21,19 and 15 years old who still live with her in her own house that she was able to buy with much effort and sacrifice.  Only the oldest of her children is independent and helps her with some of the household expenses and she as a single mother carries the responsibility of working to provide a better quality of life for her younger children

Milagro’s work is selling bags hither and yon.  She rises early and heads out to the various markets to offer bags to carry products.  She works among the markets that are nearest to her house that are the busiest in the city; she has many customers and is very well-liked because she’s charismatic and knows how to approach her customers.  She’s been in business 8 years and does it alone since her children are have to study; they help her out just for a few hours.

She likes her work because she has free time and it’s independent.  She knows that earning good income for her home depends on her work and this is why she doesn’t complain or, what would be worse, feel bad doing it.  She has many customers that she’s won over during the time she’s been working and she sells much which allows her to earn good profits.  She hopes to continue growing with what she does because it will make it possible for her to improve her family’s quality of life.  Also, she’d like to have a locale in order to sell in a more formal manner.

This will be loan #5 with MFP.  She’s very happy to know that she’ll have a loan to reach her objectives.  On her part, she commits to be punctual with her installments in order not to disappoint the group she belongs to because they are very responsible and very good.

She will use the requested 1200 soles to buy more plastic products to continue selling to her customers who are requesting larger sizes and different quality.

loans.use: to buy more plastic products.

loans.name: Pallome

texts.fr:
Pallome est une femme âgé(e) de 49 ans. Elle est mariée à un instituteur à la retraite et à 02 enfants. Le premier a 25ans et le dernier 15ans.
Pallome travaille comme revendeuse de tubercules, maïs, huile rouge et autres… depuis 1997. Elle vend à la maison à tout le monde.
Pallome a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tubercules du maïs, de l’huile rouge et autres. Elle veut avoir plus de stock et s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Pallome is 49 years old. She is married to a retired school teacher and together have two children. The oldest is 25 and the youngest is 15.
Pallome has been a retailer of yams, corn, palm oil and other products since 1997. She sells from her home to many different people.
Pallome has requested her third loan from WAGES to purchase yams, corn, palm oil and other products for resale. She would like to increase her inventory and take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase yams, corn and palm oil.

loans.name: Azimio Group

texts.en:
Seleman, who is in his early 30s, is married with three children, one of whom goes to school. The other two are still young. He has been running a business selling second-hand shoes for ten years. He works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a plot of land, increase his stock of shoes, and cover household expenses. He has paid back his loans successfully. Seleman wants a loan to buy more shoes to resale and to make bricks for building a house. His dream is to one day be able to start building his house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Aziz" which has a total of 12 members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back their loan.

loans.use: to increase his shoe stock and to make bricks for his house.

loans.name: Jose Nicolas

texts.es:
Jose sin mucho capital pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante, viene desempeñando desde hace un tiempo el servicio de arreglar los prados de las fincas de su sector, actividad con la cual ha generado los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, donde convive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos. Jose siempre se ha caracterizado por ofrecer una buena atención y ofrecer precios favorables a sus clientes, lo que le ha permitido sobresalir ante la creciente competencia. Actualmente Jose presenta la dificultad de que su guadañadora, su principal herramienta de trabajo, se encuentra averiada, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la reparación de su guadañadora, su principal herramienta de trabajo.

Jose espera que de esta manera siga ofreciendo el servicio a sus clientes y pueda seguir generando los ingresos para su hogar. Además, Jose espera que su familia pueda acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Jose does not have much money, but he does have a great desire to get ahead.  For some time he has been providing the service of mowing the fields on the farms in his area.  This business activity has generated the income needed to support his household.  He lives with his wife and five children.

Jose has always been known for the good service and favorable prices he gives his customers.  This has allowed him to excel in the presence of the growing competition.  Jose now has a problem with his mower, which is his primary work tool.  

It is broken, and he is therefore looking for a loan to repair his mower, his main working tool.  Jose hopes that this way he will continue offering his service to his customers and continue generating income for his household.  Also, Jose hopes that his family will be able to have a better quality of life and greater financial opportunities.

loans.use: to repair his mower, his main working tool.

loans.name: Zocima

texts.es:
Zocima de 50 años de edad, viuda con 3 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el centro poblado de sector Tereza del distrito de Pichari. Zocima es una madre viuda dedicado a la venta de cereales, productos que expende en las ferias que se realizan dentro de su comunidad.
Ella cuenta que ya tiene buen tiempo realizando éste negocio, siempre le ha gustado salir a las ferias a realizar sus ventas, antes vendía licor, pero desde que su camioneta sufrió una volcadura perdió el capital de su negocio, pese a ello logró sobresalir con este nuevo negocio. Zocima está contenta con este negocio que realiza, porque le genera una buena rentabilidad económica por que es la única que expende todo tipo de cereales. En adelante está pensando dedicarse a la compra venta de ganados porque vio que existe mucha demanda. Éste es su segundo préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,500 nuevos soles comprar más cereales.
texts.en:
Zocima is 50 years old and widowed with three children. They live together in a house that they own situated in the center of the Tereza sector of the Pichari district. Zocima is a widowed mother who makes a living selling cereals, which she distributes at the markets that take place in her community. 

She says that she enjoys running her business, as she has always liked going to the markets to make her sales. She used to sell liquor, but when her truck rolled over she lost the capital from that business, and as a consequence she is moving forward with this new business. Zocima is content with business she is creating. It generates a good economic profit because it is the only one that sells all types of cereals. In the future she is thinking of making a living buying and selling livestock because she has seen that there is a great deal of demand. 

This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises once again to be punctual in making her payments. With 3,500 PEN she will be able to buy more cereals.

loans.use: to buy more cereals.

loans.name: Ahad

texts.ru: Ахад добрый и трудолюбивый молодой семьянин, который на воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Жена занимается домохозяйством и присматривает за ребенком. Более 5 лет он занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. Имеет много постоянных клиентов. У него свежие продукты, также он продает разные виды напитков. Ахад запрашивает займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки свежих продуктов для пополнения оборотного капитала.
texts.en: Ahad is an honest and hardworking young family man who has one child. His wife is a homemaker and looks after the child. He has been in the business of buying and selling food for more than five years. He has many regular customers. He sells fresh food products and also different kinds of soft drinks. Ahad is asking for a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni to buy fresh food products to fulfill his working capital.

loans.use: to buy fresh food.

loans.name: Neyda

texts.es: Neyda, de 30 años, es una señora valiente y luchadora, está casada con su esposo con quien es madre de dos niños de 7 años y 4 meses, a quienes tiene que dar los cuidados necesarios ya que son aun muy chicos, vive en casa de sus suegros junto a ellos y a su esposo. Neyda, durante mucho tiempo trabajo en diversas actividades, pero desde hace algún tiempo viene realizando el de la venta de muebles al por menor, se encarga de comprar muebles a las carpinterías al por mayor, los transporta hasta su casa donde está ubicado su local y se encarga de distribuir los muebles al crédito que empieza a cobrar semanal, quincenal o mensual, de acuerdo a  las posibilidades de pago que tenga su cliente. Lleva trabajando así ya por tres años, tiene el respaldo y la ayuda de su esposo ya que juntos iniciaron en este negocio que les brinda la posibilidad de dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Le gusta de su trabajo que es muy divertido hacerlo a lado de su esposo, además tiene el tiempo a disposición para estar a lado de sus hijos, el negocio le va regular tiene su buenas temporadas pero como es una mujer que piensa a futuro tiene sus ahorros para cuando haya alguna necesidad, ella vende productos de calidad así que sus productos son muy buscados y sus clientes saben que le hacen una buena compra, desea consolidar su negocio y hacer que su negocio crezca mas. Este será el crédito número 9 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual ya que no desea quedar mal con su grupo ya que ahí son muy puntuales. Con el monto solicitado 1800 soles, comprará mas productos para vender, y así tener a sus clientes a la vanguardia de la moda en carpintería y seguir amoblando sus casas con productos de calidad.
texts.en:
Neyda, 30, is a brave, tenacious woman who’s married to her husband and is the mother of two children who are 7 and 4 months old that she wants to provide with the care they need because they are still very little.  She lives with her husband and her in-laws in their house.

For a long time Neyda has been working in a variety of jobs but for a time now has been retailing furniture.  She buys furniture at wholesale from carpentry shops, transports it to her house which is where her locale is located and then sells it on credit that she collect weekly, bi-weekly or monthly payments on according to the customer’s payment capabilities.  She’s been working this way for three years now.  Her husband backs her up and helps her since they started the business together; it gives them the possibility of providing a better quality of life for their family.

She enjoys the work because it’s fun to do it alongside her husband.  Besides, she has time available to be with her children.  The business is doing ok; it has its good times but since she’s a forward-thinking woman she has her savings set aside for when there’s need.  She sells quality products so her wares are very sought-after and her customers know that they make good purchases.  She wants to consolidate her business and make it grow more.

This will be loan #9 with MFP.  She’s very happy to know she’ll have financial support because she will feel surer of advancing with her business.  On the other hand, she commits to once again make her installment payments punctually because she does not want to disappoint her group which is very punctual.

She will use the requested 1800 soles to buy more items to sell to keep her customers in the vanguard of carpentry and continue furnishing their homes with quality products.

loans.use: to buy more furniture.

loans.name: Livingstone Odhiambo

texts.en:
Livingstone used his previous loan amount to buy raw materials for his welding business. He was able to buy them and it has been very profitable. He paid his previous loan amount well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy more stock of welding materials and to stabilize his business. 

In the future, Livingstone hopes to own plots and build commercial and residential houses to make more income.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for welding work.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 36-year-old married woman with two school-aged children. She has a general store where she sells a variety of products. She has been doing this work for five years. Each day, she earns approximately PHP 300.

Rosalinda is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase groceries such as noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar, and coffee to sell to the people of the community. She hopes that, through the loan, she can obtain more customers. In the future, Rosalinda hopes that her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is engaged in her hog-raising business in the village of Mabantad. She is 58 years old and married. They were blessed with eight children who are all married. Vilma works hard to support their daily needs and to help her children financially, even though they live separately from her.

Vilma wants her business to become more progressive and to increase her income. To this end, Vilma wants to borrow a loan in the amount of PHP 12,000 to buy feed and vaccinate her hog. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted so she can develop her business and purchase more hogs to raise.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccinate her hog.

loans.name: Allanie

texts.en:
Allanie is a 37-year-old businesswoman. She is married to Jonathan, a farmer in the village who manages their farmland. The couple has two children. Allanie wants a good future for her children. By engaging in business, she hopes to support the growing needs of her children. Allanie started managing her general store several years ago. She wanted to earn income for her family, most especially for her children. 

Allanie is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 to purchase more grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, bread and soft drinks to sell. She will use the loan as additional capital to improve and expand her retail business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, bread and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 44 years old, widowed, and has four children. As she says, being a single parent is very difficult, but Elvira still does her best just to lift her family from poor living. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a food stall. She has been engaged in her business for more than one year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell. Elvira plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell

loans.name: Clémentine

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans, Clémentine est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Tous ses enfants vont à l'école et elle même a fréquenté jusqu'au secondaire. Elle a une boutique à domicile dans laquelle elle vend des divers et chaussures . Elle a sollicité un financement auprès de Finadev en vue de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de rehausser le  niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Clémentine is 48 years old, married and has three children. All of her children attend school. She went to school through high school. She has a small store in her home where she sells a variety of items including shoes. She is requesting a loan from Finadev in order to strengthen her business capital and to help increase her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase 10 liters of oil, 4 bags of charcoal, 5 dozen pairs of shoes, 1 case of lotions and soaps.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials and a work table.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y esto le ha permitido superar grandes adversidades que le ha presentado la vida. Desde hace aproximadamente 25 años, Luis se ha dedicado a la comercialización de productos; en un principio comercializaba medicamentos y le tocaba esforzarse con sus clientes para poder recuperar su cartera, posteriormente pasó a comercializar alimentos y hace aproximadamente 5 meses compró el negocio donde actualmente trabaja que es una tienda donde ofrece toda clase de productos de la canasta familiar. Gracias a esto, Luis genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Con la finalidad de aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, Luis busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

De esta manera, Luis espera que su negocio crezca y se consolide en el sector, y sus clientes encuentren en su negocio una buena atención y una gran variedad de productos. Además, Luis espera que su negocio le genere mayores ingresos que los que generaban sus otros negocios y así pueda ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis has always been characterized by being a person who very much wants to get ahead and this has allowed him to overcome great diversities life has presented him.  

For the last 25 years approximately Luis has been selling products.  First he sold medicine and had to struggle to get his customers to pay their bills; then he went into selling foodstuffs and about five months ago bought the business he’s currently in which is a store selling all kinds of basic staple items.  Thanks to this Luis generates the income needed to support his home.  

Aiming at increasing the variety of products he offers his customers, Luis is looking for a loan that will give him the possibility of buying basic staple items to offer greater variety to his customers.

In this way Luis hopes his business will grow and consolidate within the sector and that his customers will find good service and a wide variety of products in his store.  Luis hopes his store will generate higher income than what his previous businesses did so that he can offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items to stock his store.

loans.name: Kisanga Group

texts.en:
Hamdan, who is in his mid 50's, is married and has eight children.   Five of them are still going to school. He has been a tailor since 1995.  He works from 7.00am to 6.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy sewing items like thread and materials.   He managed to take care of his family and has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to buy more materials for his business. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kisanga", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more materials for his tailoring business,

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée å un gendarme. Elle a deux enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 12 ans et le dernier a 5 ans.
Akossiwa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2010. Elle vend des pagnes et des tissus pour tous clients dans la ville. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est le retard de paiement de certains clients.
Akossiwa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Akossiwa voudrait agrandir son activité et y associer la vente d’alimentation générale. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is 28 years old and is married to a police officer. She has two children (aged 12 and 5) who are in school. 

Akossiwa has been a vendor since 2010. She sells pagnes and fabric for clients in the city. She buys her products in Lomé and works on her own. At the moment, her main problem is late payments from some of her clients. 

Akossiwa has asked for her first loan from WAGES to buy pagnes. She would like to reinvest in her business. Over the next few years, Akossiwa would like to expand her business and start selling groceries. With the profits, she would like to assure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy pagnes

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 59 years old, married, and has five children. She has been operating her retail store for a long year and she is glad because her business is improving and growing. She is able to earn about PHP 4,500 a month and uses her profit to pay for her family's electric bills and daily needs. 

Myrna suffered difficulties in her business due to much unpaid credit from her customers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to allow her to buy groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, baked breads, and other items for her retail shop business. She hopes to obtain this loan so that she can improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, baked breads, and other items for her retail shop business

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is married with four children who attend school. He is from the village of Mabantad. He has been selling ice cream in the village where he lives with his family. He earns about 300 PHP a day. Marlon is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP which he will use to purchase raw ingredients for ice cream such as milk and different flavorings. In the future, he would like to expand his business, to lift up his family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for ice cream such as milk and different flavorings.

loans.name: Billiah

texts.en: Billiah is a businesswoman. She sells second-hand clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and describes her customers as low income earners because they live in slums. She also farms to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand it in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is married with four children. One of them works while two of her remaining children are in school. 
Her husband is an electrician by profession, providing electrical systems and repairing electrical items for his clients. He is very experienced in his work and possesses good skills. He has a good number of clients who pay him good money for his work. 
Kalsoom is a housewife, fulfilling her household responsibilities. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband who will buy electricity repair tools to offer better quality services to his clients. 
Kalsoom is very confident that her husband will make good use of the loan and improve his business. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kalsoom.”

loans.use: To buy electrical repair tools.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz Amparo en un principio comenzó a enviar hojas de vida a muchas empresas con el fin de encontrar un lugar donde emplearse, pero las pocas oportunidades que se presentaron la llevaron a estudiar modistería y montar su propio negocio de confección. De esta manera, genera ingresos con los cuales contribuye económicamente en su hogar, donde convive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer el acceso a una educación de calidad. Luz Amparo inició su taller con muy poco capital pero con muchas ganas de sacarlo adelante, y fue esta actitud la que le permitió salir adelante por encima de las adversidades y a consolidar su negocio ante sus clientes. Actualmente Luz Amparo tiene grandes contratos para confeccionar uniformes empresariales y de colegio, y además, le ha surgido un nuevo cliente que le ha estado proponiendo el negocio de confeccionar tendidos y acolchados. Con el ánimo de poder aceptar esta propuesta de su cliente, Luz Amparo busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina de coser con la cual pueda elaborar tendidos y acolchados y siga creciendo su negocio. 

De esta manera, Luz Amparo espera seguir consolidando su negocio y generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. Además, Luz Amparo espera que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación de mayor calidad.
texts.en:
Luz Amparo started out sending résumés to many firms hoping to find someplace to work but the few opportunities that arose led her to study dressmaking and to open her own dressmaking business.  In this way she generates income to contribute to her home where she lives with her husband and two children that she’s always wanted to provide a quality education for.  

Luz Amparo started her shop with very little capital but with much drive to move it ahead and it was this attitude that allowed her to get ahead despite adversity and to consolidate her business with of her customers.

Luz Amparo currently has large contracts to manufacture business and school uniforms and she's just gotten a new customer that wants her to start making bedspreads and quilts.   Hoping to accept this customer’s proposal, Luz Amparo is looking for a loan that will give her the possibility of buying a sewing machine with which to make the bedspreads and quilts so that her business can continue growing.

In this way, Luz Amparo hopes to continue consolidating her business and generating employment for people most in need.  Also, Luz Amparo hopes that with higher income her family can enjoy a better quality of life and her children can access a higher quality education.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 40 years old, and is married with three children. 

Lucy does tailoring to earn a living. She has been in the business for 22 years and has employed two people. She describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Lucy has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.use: To buy a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Samuel Wambugu

texts.en:
Samuel used his previous loan amount for the harvesting of his maize. He was able to harvest and sell, and it was very profitable. He repaid all the loan amount well and in good time. Besides farming, he also runs a retail shop business. 

He plans to use this loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting during this planting season. He also plans to use part of the loan amount to buy more stock of wheat flour and washing detergent to sell in his shop. 

In the future, Samuel hopes to expand both his farming and business and thereby make more income and improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting, and also to buy wheat flour and washing detergent for his retail shop

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who has a business of selling betel leaves, cold drinks, and cigarettes. He runs a shop in the market where he sells these products. 

With the loan investment, he will buy cold drinks, cigarettes, betel leaves in larger quantities, which will allow him to make more profit from his business. 

He has been operating his business for the past many years and Robina is very confident about his business success after investing the loan into it. 

Robina herself operates a sewing business. Her work is home-based. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She does this work to financially contribute to the family.  '

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Robina.

loans.use: To buy cold drinks, cigarettes, and betel leaves for selling

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 41-year-old married woman living in Enrile with her only child. Her spouse works abroad. She established a small store to add to her spouse's income. She has been running her store for three years now. 

She would like to offer more products so she is borrowing a loan for P10,000 to buy bottled beverages, eggs and noodles to sell in her store.

Teresita would like to provide a good education for her child, as the only legacy she can pass on to her.

loans.use: to buy bottled beverages, eggs and noodles to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo's business is tailoring. He sews all kinds of uniforms and sportswear. He is 44 years old and married to a housekeeper. The couple has three children. Two of them attend school. 

He would like to improve his services to acquire regular customers so he is asking for a loan of P6,000. He will use it to buy fabric and thread. 

Someday, he hopes to earn a good profit from his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Uzima Group

texts.en:
Ahmed, who is in his early 60's, is married and has four children who are adults.  He has several grandchildren. He has been selling second-hand shoes for three years now. He works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to increase the shoe stock and to take care of household expenses. He  has paid back his loan successfully.  He wants a loan in order to sell at wholesale prices and to open another shop for the same business. His dream is to finish building his house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Uzima", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to sell at wholesale price and to open another shop for the same business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials and cameras.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Carismática y trabajadora son las mejores palabras con las que se puede describir a Luz Dary, una persona que a pesar de las grandes adversidades que le ha presentado la vida ha tenido la fortaleza para seguir adelante y continuar progresando junto con su familia. Luz Dary trabaja como empleada doméstica y con esto aporta económicamente en su hogar para el sostenimiento de sus hijos, sin embargo, los ingresos que genera no son suficientes en algunos momentos para cubrir todos los gastos que se generan en su hogar. Hace un tiempo Luz Dary cultivaba en un terreno que tiene detrás de su casa algunas verduras, sin embargo, por los fuertes inviernos de la época y el poco capital con el que contaba para poder sostener sus cultivos se vio en la obligación de cerrarlo y dejarlo a un lado por un tiempo. Actualmente, Luz Dary espera que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de semilas, riegos y abonos para poder reiniciar su cultivo de verduras y así generar ingresos adicionales para su familia.

Luz Dary espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues ya tiene experiencia en la actividad de cultivar verduras y con esto podrá suplir mayores necesidades que ahora. Además, Luz Dary espera que con mayores ingresos su hija pueda acceder a una educación de mayor calidad y a mejores oportunidades económicas que les permita progresar con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
“Charismatic” and “Hardworking” are the best words to describe Luz Dary, a person who despite the great adversities life has thrown in her path, has had the strength to continue forward and make progress with her family.

Luz Dary works as a domestic employee and contributes economically this way to her home to support her children.  However, income generated is insufficient at present to cover all her household expenses.  

Some time ago, Luz Dary used to farm vegetables on a parcel of land behind her house.  However, due to the strong winters in the season and the little available capital she had to maintain her crops she had to close it and leave it aside for a time.  Now, Luz Dary hopes that the loan will make it possible for her to buy seeds, irrigation and manure to restart her vegetable farming thus generating additional income for her family.

Luz Dary hopes that this way her income will increase considerably because she already has vegetable farming experience and she could cover more needs this way.  Also, Luz Dary hopes that with higher income her daughter can access a higher quality education and better economic opportunities that will allow them to make progress more easily.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Sakina Begum's Group

texts.en:
Sakina begum is a 40 year-old married woman.  She has seven children: six sons and one daughter.  Four of her sons are enrolled in a school and getting their education.  Sakina is a very caring and dedicated woman. She spends her time at home by doing household work and taking care of her family.  Her husband is involved in an animal sales business. He is very experienced in his business and has been doing it for over 8 years. He buys young animals from animal markets and sells to his clients at profit. His clientele consists of butchers. He is very knowledgeable in his profession.  

Sakina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying goats to sell.  
Sakina is very confident that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband’s business. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sakina begum”.

loans.use: To buy goats for animal sales business

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the village of Mabantad.  To make a living, Jose provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged to his business for more than one year and earns approximately 300 PHP daily.

As of now, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase spare parts and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle to improve his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 46 years old. He is married and a father of nine children who are between 25 and 10 years old. He practices dairy farming on his farm, which has been in operation for a period of 20 years.  He earns a monthly income of KES.10,000.

He is requesting his second loan of KES.50,000 from KADET LTD. after he repaid the previous loan successfully.  He wishes to use this amount to purchase two dairy cows. The profits will be used to plow back into the farm.

He hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is 32 years old, married to Eric, and blessed with two children aged eight and four years respectively. She hawks clothes, shoes, and bags, a business she started two years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 55,000. 

She has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase a bale of clothes and shoes to sell. The profit she earns from this business would help her purchase additional stock for her business. 

Her dream is to own a number of boutiques in Eldoret as well as educate her children. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
35-year-old Irene and her husband Paul are blessed with two children ages 14 and 10 years. She has a retail store, a business she started three years ago, and she earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES). 

She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase 5 bales of baking flour, 10 boxes of bar soaps, and 5 sacks of sugar.

The profit earned from the business will help her save to buy a matatu (a mini-bus for public transportation). Her dream is to keep her family well. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase 5 bales of baking flour, 10 boxes of bar soaps, and 5 sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 38 years old. She and her husband Samuel are blessed with four children ages 12,10, 8, and 2 years. She practices dairy farming alongside poultry. She started this business 6 years ago and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

Christine has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase animal feeds. The anticipated profit will be used to improve her business as well as repaying her loan.

Her dream is to eradicate poverty in her society. This is her second loan.

loans.use: To purchase animal feeds for her cattle and chickens.

loans.name: Maria Deyanira

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Maria se encuentra casada y tiene un hijo de 6 años a quien siempre le ha querido ofrecer una educación de buena calidad. Desde hace ya varios años, Maria contribuye económicamente en su hogar con la venta de productos de uso personal que vende a través de catálogo, y sus principales clientes son familiares, amigos y vecinos. Con este negocio su familia ha podido tener mayores ingresos y gracias a esto pueden gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Debido al buen servicio y a la buena atención que ofrece, ha tenido la oportunidad de captar un gran número de clientes que le garantizan muy buenas ventas en su negocio. Con el ánimo de comprar mercancía para responder a pedidos que le han hecho, Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal para poder responder a los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

Maria espera que de esta manera pueda seguir generando ingresos para su familia, además de poder acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. Maria sueña con que en un futuro su negocio crezca y pueda montar un almacén donde genere empleo para los más necesitados y con el cual pueda ofrecer una estabilidad económica en su hogar.
texts.en:
María has always been characterized by being a very hardworking person who always wants to offer her family a better quality of life.  María is married and has a six year old son that she’s always wanted to offer a good quality education to.  For several years now María has been contributing economically to her home selling personal use items that she sells via catalogue.  Her main customers are families, friends and neighbors.  With this business the family has been able to have higher income and thanks to it can enjoy a better quality of life.  

Due to the good service and customer care she provides, she’s won over a good number of customers which guarantees very good sales in her business.  Aiming at buying more merchandise to fill pending orders, María is looking for a loan that will give her the opportunity of buying personal use items to respond to orders her customers have placed with her.

María hopes in this way to be able to continue generating income for her family as well as to be able to access a better quality of life and greater opportunities for making progress.  María dreams that he business will grow in the future and that she will be able to open a store to generate employment for those most in need and that will allow her to offer economic stability for her home.

loans.use: to buy personal use products.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is 50 years old, still very active and performs her household duties very well. She has given birth to a son who works for a monthly wage.  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will put different grocery items, such as spices, cooking oils, sugar, and cold drinks in his store to meet his clients' needs and increase his sales and income. 
He is very experienced in his work and his store is very popular among his customers. 
Perveen is hopeful that the loan will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and will increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 32 years old and married with two children. She works at dairy farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and describes her business environment as competitive because many people are in the same business. To earn extra income she does tailoring. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 34 years old, married, and blessed with four children aged 10, 8, 6, and 4 years respectively.  She sells charcoal, a business she started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal for sale. 

The profit she earns from this will be ploughed back into her business. Her dream is to open a wholesale business. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is 25 years old. She sells electronics to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and describes her business environment as busy because she is visited regularly by her customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her electronics shop to a wholesale one in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy sockets, cables, and bulbs to sell.

loans.use: To buy sockets, cables, and bulbs to sell

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr:
Anani est un homme âgé de 38 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il a un enfant de 12 ans qui va à l’école.
Anani travaille comme projectionniste depuis 2009. Il projette des matchs de football et fait en parallèle de l’élevage de poules pour tous clients à domicile. Il travaille avec 2 employés. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est liée aux maladies des poules.
Anani a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’élargir son poulailler. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Anani voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité et vendre également des boissons. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Anani is a 38-year old man. He is married to a retailer. He has a twelve-year old child, who goes to school.

Since 2009, Anani has been working as a projectionist. He shows soccer games, and as a secondary activity he raises chickens and sells them to customers from his home. He works with two employees. At the moment, his biggest challenge is related to diseases that affect the chickens.

Anani has obtained a second loan from WAGES in order to expand his hen house. He wants to re-invest in his business.
Over the next few years, Anani would like to increase his activity. and sell drinks as well. He says that with the profits, he plans to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to expand his hen house.

loans.name: Ndinda

texts.en:
Ndinda is 42 years old, and is married with two children.

Ndinda sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living. She has been in the business for 19 years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as good because she has many regular customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future.

She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy tomatoes, mangoes, and oranges to sell.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, mangoes, and oranges to sell.

loans.name: Clare

texts.en:
Clare is 26 years old, and she runs a butcher shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 2 years and has employed one person.

Clare describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to open many butcher shops in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a thirty-four-year-old lady who is married with three children. She has a cereals business in Kimana. She has been in the business for three years and gets a monthly income of 23,900 shillings. 

This will be Sophia’s first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock of dry maize, beans, and green grams for sale. With the profit she wants to expand her business and improve her farm. 

In future she wants to be able to expand her cereals and farming business.

loans.use: To buy more stock.

loans.name: Rabeka

texts.en:
Rabeka is 51 years old, married, and has four children. She does livestock keeping to earn a living. She has been in the business for eleven years and has employed one person. To earn extra income, she does crop farming. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy animal feed and a water pump.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and a water pump.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 29 years old and a mother of two children ages 7 and 4 years.

Alice owns a bar, which is a business she ventured in four years ago and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES). She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES that she will use to purchase 10 crates of beer, 4 crates of soda, and a box of wine.

The profit she earns from this business will help her add more stock to her business. Her dream is to be a successful businesswoman and to educate her children. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase 10 crates of beer, 4 crates of soda, and a box of wine.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
